verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:1
verses.text: Hymns on the Nativity.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:2
verses.text: Hymn I.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:3
verses.text: This is the day that gladdened them, the Prophets, Kings, and Priests, for in it were their words fulfilled, and thus were the whole of them indeed performed! For the Virgin this day brought forth Immanuel in Bethlehem.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:4
verses.text: The voice that of old Isaiah spake, to-day became reality.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:5
verses.text: He was born there who in writing should tell the Gentiles' number! The Psalm that David once sang, by its fulfilment came to-day! The word that Micah once spake, to-day was come indeed to pass! For there came from Ephrata a Shepherd, and His staff swayed over souls.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:6
verses.text: Lo! from Jacob shone the Star, and from Israel rose the Head.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:7
verses.text: The prophecy that Balaam spake had its interpreting to-day! Down also came the hidden Light, and from the Body rose His beauty! The light that spake in Zachary, to-day shined in Bethlehem!  Risen is the Light of the kingdom, in Ephrata the city of the King.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:8
verses.text: The blessing wherewith Jacob blessed, to its fulfilment came to-day! That tree likewise, [the tree] of life, brings hope to mortal men! Solomon's hidden proverb had to-day its explanation! To-day was born the Child, and His name was called Wonder! For a wonder it is that God as a Babe should show Himself.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:9
verses.text: By the word Worm did the Spirit foreshow Him in parable, because His generation was without marriage.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:10
verses.text: The type that the Holy Ghost figured to-day its meaning was [explained.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:11
verses.text: ] He came up as a root before Him, as a root of parched ground.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:12
verses.text: Aught that covertly was said, openly to-day was done! The King that in Judah was hidden, Thamar stole Him from his thigh; to-day arose His conquering beauty, which in hidden estate she loved.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:13
verses.text: Ruth at Boaz' side lay down, because the Medicine of Life hidden in him she perceived.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:14
verses.text: To-day was fulfilled her vow, since from her seed arose the Quickener of all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:15
verses.text: Travail Adam on the woman brought, that from him had come forth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:16
verses.text: She to-day her travail ransomed, who to her a Saviour bare! To Eve our mother a man gave birth, who himself had had no birth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:17
verses.text: How much more should Eve's daughter be believed to have borne a Child without a man! The virgin earth, she bare that Adam that was head over the earth! The Virgin bare to-day the Adam that was Head over the Heavens.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:18
verses.text: The staff of Aaron, it budded, and the dry wood yielded fruit! Its mystery is cleared up to-day, for the virgin womb a Child hath borne!  Shamed is that people which holds the prophets as true; for unless our Saviour has come, their words have been falsified! Blessed be the True One Who came from the Father of the Truth and fulfilled the true seers' words, which were accomplished in their truth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:19
verses.text: From thy treasure-house put forth, Lord, from the coffers of Thy Scriptures, names of righteous men of old, who looked to see Thy coming! Seth who was in Abel's stead shadowed out the Son as slain, by Whose death was dulled the envy Cain had brought into the world! Noah saw the sons of God, saints that sudden waxed wanton, and the Holy Son he looked for, by whom lewd men were turned to holiness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:20
verses.text: The brothers twain, that covered Noah, saw the only Son of God who should come to hide the nakedness of Adam, who was drunk with pride.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:21
verses.text: Shem and Japhet, being gracious, looked for the gracious Son, Who should come and set free Canaan from the servitude of sin.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:22
verses.text: Melchizedek expected Him; as His vicegerent, looked that he might see the Priesthood's Lord whose hyssop purifies the world.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:23
verses.text: Lot beheld the Sodomites how they perverted nature: for nature's Lord he looked who gave a holiness not natural.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:24
verses.text: Him Aaron looked for, for he saw that if his rod ate serpents up, His cross would eat the Serpent up that had eaten Adam and Eve.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:25
verses.text: Moses saw the uplifted serpent that had cured the bites of asps, and he looked to see Him who would heal the ancient Serpent's wound.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:26
verses.text: Moses saw that he himself alone retained the brightness from God, and he looked for Him who came and multiplied gods by His teaching:  Caleb the spy bore the cluster on the staff, and came and longed to see the Cluster, Whose wine should comfort the world.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:27
verses.text: Him did Jesus son of Nun long for, that he might conceive the force of his own surname: for if by His name he waxed so mighty, how much more would He by His Birth? This Jesus that gathered and carried, and brought with him of the fruit, was longing for the Tree of Life to taste the Fruit that quickens all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:28
verses.text: For Him Rahab too was looking; for when the scarlet thread in type redeemed her from wrath, in type she tasted of the Truth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:29
verses.text: For Him Elijah longed, and when Him on earth he saw not, he, through faith most throughly cleansed, mounted up in heaven to see Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:30
verses.text: Moses saw Him and Elijah; the meek man from the depth ascended, the zealous from on high descended, and in the midst beheld the Son.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:31
verses.text: They figured the mystery of His Advent: Moses was a type of the dead, and Elijah a type of the living, that fly to meet Him at His coming.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:32
verses.text: For the dead that have tasted death, them He makes to be first: and the rest that are not buried, are last caught up to meet Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:33
verses.text: Who is there that can count me up the just that looked for the Son, whose number cannot be determined by the mouth of us weak creatures? Pray ye for me, O beloved, that another time with strength endued, I in another legend may so set forth their foretaste, as I am able.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:34
verses.text: Who is adequate to the praising of the Son of the Truth that has risen to us? For it was for Him the righteous longed, that in their generation they might see Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:35
verses.text: Adam looked for Him, for He is the Cherub's Lord, and could minister an entrance and a residence hard by the branches of the Tree of life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:36
verses.text: Abel longed after Him, that in his days He might come; that instead of that lamb that he offered, the Lamb of God he might behold.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:37
verses.text: For Him Eve also looked; for woman's nakedness was sore, and He capable to clothe them; not with leaves, but with that same glory that they had exchanged away.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:38
verses.text: The tower that the many builded, in mystery looked for One, who coming down would build on earth a tower that lifts up to Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:39
verses.text: Yea the ark of living creatures looked in a type for our Lord; for He should build the Holy Church, wherein souls find a refuge.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:40
verses.text: In Peleg's days earth was divided into tongues, threescore and ten.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:41
verses.text: For Him Who by the tongues, to His Apostles divided earth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:42
verses.text: Earth which the flood had swallowed up, in silence cried to her Lord.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:43
verses.text: He came down and opened Baptism, and men were drawn by it to Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:44
verses.text: Seth and Enos, Cainan too, were surnamed sons of God; for the Son of God they looked, that they by grace might be His brethren.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:45
verses.text: But little short of a thousand years did Methuselah live: He looked for the Son Who makes heirs of life that never ends! Grace itself in hidden mystery was beseeching on their behalf that their Lord might come in their age and fill up their shortcomings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:46
verses.text: For the Holy Spirit in them, in their stead, besought with meditation: He stirred them up, and in Him did they look on that Redeemer, after whom they longed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:47
verses.text: The soul of just men perceive in the Son a Medicine of life; and so it felt desires that He might come in its own days, and then would it taste His sweetness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:48
verses.text: Enoch was longing for Him, and since on earth the Son he saw not, he was justified by great faith, and mounted up in Heaven to see Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:49
verses.text: Who is there that will spurn at grace, when the Gift that they of old gained not by much labour, freely comes to men now? For Him Lamech also looked who might come and lovingly give Him quiet from his labour and the toiling of his hands, and from the earth the Just One had cursed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:50
verses.text: Lamech then beheld his son, Noah,—him, in whom were figured types relating to the Son.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:51
verses.text: In the stead of the Lord afar off, the type at hand afforded quiet.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:52
verses.text: Yea Noah also longed to see Him, the taste of whose assisting graces he had tasted.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:53
verses.text: For if the type of Him preserved living things, Himself how sure to bestow life upon souls! Noah longed for Him, by trial knowing Him, for through Him had the ark been established.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:54
verses.text: For if the type of Him thus saved life, assuredly much more would He in person.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:55
verses.text: Abraham perceived in Spirit that the Son's Birth was far off; instead of Him in person he rejoiced to see even His day.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:56
verses.text: To see Him Isaac longed, as having tasted the taste of His redemption; for if the sign of Him so gave life, much more would He by the reality.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:57
verses.text: Joyous were to-day the Watchers, that the Wakeful came to wake us! Who would pass this night in slumber, in which all the world was watching? Since Adam brought into the world the sleep of death by sins, the Wakeful came down that He might awake us from the deep sleep of sin.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:58
verses.text: Watch not we as usurers, who thinking on money put to interest, watch at night so oft, to reckon up their capital, and interest.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:59
verses.text: Wakeful and cautious is the thief, who in the earth hath buried and concealed his sleep.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:60
verses.text: His wakefulness all [comes to] this, that he may cause much wakefulness to them that be asleep.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:61
verses.text: Wakeful likewise is the glutton, who hath eaten much and is restless; his watching is to him his torment, because he was impatient of stint.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:62
verses.text: Wakeful likewise is the merchant; of a night he works his fingers telling over what pounds are coming, and if his wealth doubles or trebles.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:63
verses.text: Wakeful likewise is the rich man, whose sleep his riches chase away: his dogs sleep; he guards his treasures from the thieves.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:64
verses.text: Wakeful also is the careful, by his care his sleep is swallowed: though his end stands by his pillow, yet he wakes with cares for years to come.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:65
verses.text: Satan teaches, O my brethren, one watching instead of another; to good deeds to be sleepy, and to ill awake and watchful.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:66
verses.text: Even Judas Iscariot, for the whole night through was wakeful; and he sold the righteous Blood, that purchased the whole world.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:67
verses.text: The son of the dark one put on darkness, having stripped the Light from off him: and Him who created silver, for silver the thief sold.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:68
verses.text: Yea, Pharisees, the dark one's sons, all the night through kept awake: the dark ones watched that they might veil the Light which is unlimited.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:69
verses.text: Ye then watch as [heaven's] lights in this night of starry light.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:70
verses.text: For though so dark be its colour yet in virtue it is clear.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:71
verses.text: For whoever is like this clear One, wakeful and prayerful in darkness, him in this darkness visible a light unseen surrounds! The bad man that in daylight stands, yet as a son of darkness deals; though with light clad outwardly, inly is with darkness girt.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:72
verses.text: Be we not deceived, beloved, by the fact that we are watching! For whoso does not rightly watch, his watch is an unrighteous watch.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:73
verses.text: Whoso watches not cheerfully, his watching is but a sleeping: whoso also watches not innocently, even his waking is his foe.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:74
verses.text: This is the waking of the envious one! a solid mass, compact with harm.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:75
verses.text: That watch is but a trafficking, with scorn and mockery compact.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:76
verses.text: The wrathful man if he wakes, fretful with wrath his wake will be, and his watching proves to him full of rage and of cursings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:77
verses.text: If the babbler be waking, then his mouth becomes a passage which for sins is ready but for prayers shows hindrance.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:78
verses.text: The wise man, if so be he that watches, one of two things chooseth him; either takes sweet, moderate, sleep, or a holy vigil keeps.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:79
verses.text: That night is fair, wherein He Who is Fair rose to come and make us fair.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:80
verses.text: Let not aught that may disturb it enter into our watch! Fair be kept the ear's approach, chaste the seeing of the eye! hallowed the musing of the heart! the speaking of the mouth be cleared.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:81
verses.text: Mary hid in us to-day leaven that came from Abraham.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:82
verses.text: Let us then so pity beggars as did Abraham the needy.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:83
verses.text: To-day the rennet fell on us from the gentle David's house.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:84
verses.text: Let a man show mercy to his persecutors, as did Jesse's son to Saul.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:85
verses.text: The prophets' sweet salt is to-day sprinkled among the Gentiles.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:86
verses.text: Let us gain a new savour by that whereby the ancient people lost their savour.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:87
verses.text: Let us speak the speech of wisdom; speak we not of things outside it, lest we ourselves be outside it!  In this night of reconcilement let no man be wroth or gloomy! in this night that stills all, none that threatens or disturbs! This night belongs to the sweet One; bitter or harsh be in it none! In this night that is the meek One's, high or haughty be in it none! In this day of pardoning let us not exact trespasses! In this day of gladnesses let us not spread sadnesses! In this day so sweet, let us not be harsh! In this day of peaceful rest, let us not be wrathful in it! In this day when God came to sinners, let not the righteous be in his mind uplifted over sinner! In this day in which there came the Lord of all unto the servants, let masters too condescend to their servants lovingly! In this day in which the Rich became poor for our sakes, let the rich man make the poor man share with him at his table.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:88
verses.text: On this day to us came forth the Gift, although we asked it not! Let us therefore bestow alms on them that cry and beg of us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:89
verses.text: This is the day that opened for us a gate on high to our prayers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:90
verses.text: Let us open also gates to supplicants that have transgressed, and of us have asked [forgiveness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:91
verses.text: ] To-day the Lord of nature was against His nature changed; let it not to us be irksome to turn our evil wills.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:92
verses.text: Fixed in nature is the body; great or less it cannot become: but the will has such dominion, it can grow to any measure.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 1:93
verses.text: To-day Godhead sealed itself upon Manhood, that so with the Godhead's stamp Manhood might be adorned.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:1
verses.text: Hymn II.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:2
verses.text: Blessed be that Child, Who gladdened Bethlehem to-day! Blessed be the Babe Who made manhood young again to-day! Blessed be the Fruit, Who lowered Himself to our famished state! Blessed be the Good One, Who suddenly enriched our necessitousness and supplied our needs! Blessed He Whose tender mercies made Him condescend to visit our infirmities!  Praise to the Fountain that was sent for our propitiation.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:3
verses.text: Praise be to Him Who made void the Sabbath by fulfilling it! Praise too to Him Who rebuked the leprosy and it remained not, Whom the fever saw and fled! Praise to the Merciful, Who bore our toil! Glory to Thy coming, which quickened the sons of men!  Glory to Him, Who came to us by His first-born! Glory to the Silence, that spake by His Voice.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:4
verses.text: Glory to the One on high, Who was seen by His Day-spring! Glory to the Spiritual, Who was pleased to have a Body, that in it His virtue might be felt, and He might by that Body show mercy on His household's bodies!  Glory to that Hidden One, Whose Son was made manifest! Glory to that Living One, Whose Son was made to die! Glory to that Great One, Whose Son descended and was small! Glory to the Power Who did straiten His greatness by a form, His unseen nature by a shape! With eye and mind we have beheld Him, yea with both of them.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:5
verses.text: Glory to that Hidden One, Who even with the mind cannot be felt at all by them that pry into Him; but by His graciousness was felt by the hand of man! The Nature that could not be touched, by His hands was bound and tied, by His feet was pierced and lifted up.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:6
verses.text: Himself of His own will He embodied for them that took Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:7
verses.text: Blessed be He Whom free will crucified, because He let it: blessed be He Whom the wood also did bear, because He allowed it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:8
verses.text: Blessed be He Whom the grave bound, that had [thereby] a limit set it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:9
verses.text: Blessed be He Whose own will brought Him to the Womb and Birth, to arms and to increase [in stature].

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:10
verses.text: Blessed He whose changes purchased life for human nature.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:11
verses.text: Blessed He Who sealed our soul, and adorned it and espoused it to Himself.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:12
verses.text: Blessed He Who made our Body a tabernacle for His unseen Nature.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:13
verses.text: Blessed He Who by our tongue interpreted His secret things.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:14
verses.text: Let us praise that Voice whose glory is hymned with our lute, and His virtue with our harp.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:15
verses.text: The Gentiles have assembled and have come to hear His strains.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:16
verses.text: Glory to the Son of the Good One, Whom the sons of the evil one rejected! Glory to the Son of the Just One, Whom the sons of wickedness crucified! Glory to Him Who loosed us, and was bound for us all! Glory to Him Who gave the pledge, and redeemed it too! Glory to the Beautiful, Who conformed us to His image! Glory to that Fair One, Who looked not to our foulnesses!  Glory to Him Who sowed His Light in the darkness, and was reproached in His hidden state, and covered His secret things.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:17
verses.text: He also stripped and took off from us the clothing of our filthiness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:18
verses.text: Glory be to Him on high, Who mixed His salt in our minds, His leaven in our souls.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:19
verses.text: His Body became Bread, to quicken our deadness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:20
verses.text: Praise to the Rich, Who paid for us all, that which He borrowed not; and wrote [His bill], and also became our debtor! By His yoke He brake from us the chains of him that led us captive.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:21
verses.text: Glory to the Judge Who was judged, and made His Twelve to sit in judgment on the tribes, and by ignorant men condemned the scribes of that nation!  Glory to Him Who could never be measured by us! Our heart is too small for Him, yea our mind is too feeble.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:22
verses.text: He makes foolish our littleness by the riches of His Wisdom.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:23
verses.text: Glory to Him, Who lowered Himself, and asked; that He might hear and learn that which He knew; that He might by His questions reveal the treasure of His helpful graces!  Let us adore Him Who enlightened with His doctrine our mind, and in our hearing sought a pathway for His words.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:24
verses.text: Praise we Him Who grafted into our tree His fruit.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:25
verses.text: Thanks to Him Who sent His Heir, that by Him He might draw us to Himself, yea make us heirs with Him! Thanks to that Good One, the cause of all goods!  Blessed He Who did not chide, because that He was good! Blessed He Who did not spurn, because that He was just also! Blessed He Who was silent, and rebuked; that He might quicken us with both! Severe His silence and reproachful.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:26
verses.text: Mild His severity even When He was accusing; for He rebuked the traitor, and kissed the thief.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:27
verses.text: Glory to the hidden Husbandman of our intellects! His seed fell on to our ground, and made our mind rich.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:28
verses.text: His increase came an hundredfold into the treasury of our souls! Let us adore Him Who sat down and took rest; and walked in the way, so that the Way was in the way, and the Door also for them that go in, by which they go in to the kingdom.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:29
verses.text: Blessed the Shepherd Who became a Lamb for our reconcilement! Blessed the Branch Who became the Cup of our Redemption! Blessed also be the Cluster, Fount of medicine of life! Blessed also be the Tiller, Who became Wheat, that He might be sown; and a Sheaf, that He might be cut! [Blessed be] the Architect Who became a Tower for our place of safety! Blessed He Who so tempered the feelings of our mind, that we with our harp should sing that which the winged creatures' mouth knows not with its strains to sing! Glory to Him, Who beheld how we had pleased to be like to brutes in our rage and our greediness; and came down and was one of us, that we might become heavenly!  Glory be to Him, Who never felt the need of our praising Him; yet felt the need as being kind to us, and thirsted as loving us, and asks us to give to Him, and longs to give to us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:30
verses.text: His fruit was mingled with us men, that in Him we might come nigh to Him, Who condescended to us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:31
verses.text: By the Fruit of His stem He grafted us into His Tree.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:32
verses.text: Let us praise Him, Who prevailed and quickened us by His stripes! Praise we Him, Who took away the curse by His thorns! Praise we Him Who put death to death by His dying! Praise we Him, Who held His peace and justified us! Praise we Him, Who rebuked death that had overcome us! Blessed He, Whose helpful graces cleansed out the left side!  Praise we Him Who watched and put to sleep him that led us captive.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:33
verses.text: Praise we Him Who went to sleep, and chased our deep sleep away.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:34
verses.text: Glory be to God Who cured weak manhood! Glory be to Him Who was baptized, and drowned our iniquity in the deep, and choked him that choked us! Let us glorify with all our mouths the Lord of all creatures!  Blessed be the Physician Who came down and amputated without pain, and healed wounds with a medicine that was not harsh.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:35
verses.text: His Son became a Medicine, that showed sinners mercy.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:36
verses.text: Blessed be He Who dwelt in the womb, and wrought therein a perfect Temple, that He might dwell in it, a Throne that He might be in it, a Garment that He might be arrayed in it, and a Weapon that He might conquer in it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:37
verses.text: Blessed be He Whom our mouth cannot adequately praise, because His Gift is too great for skill of orators [to tell]; neither can the faculties adequately praise His goodness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:38
verses.text: For praise Him as we may, it is too little.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:39
verses.text: And since it is useless to be silent and to constrain ourselves, may our feebleness excuse such praise as we can sing.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 2:40
verses.text: How gracious He, Who demands not more than our strength can give! How would Thy servant be condemned in capital and interest, did he not give such as he could, and did he refuse that which He owed! Ocean of glory Who needest not to have Thy glory sung, take in Thy goodness this drop of praise; since by Thy Gift Thou hast supplied my tongue a sense for glorifying Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:1
verses.text: Hymn III.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:2
verses.text: Blessed be that first day of thine, Lord, wherewith this day of Thy Feast is stamped! Thy day is like Thee, in that it shows mercy unto men, in that it is handed down and comes with all generations.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:3
verses.text: This is the day that ends with the aged, and returns that it may begin with the young! a day that by its love refreshes itself, that it may refresh by its might us decayed creatures.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:4
verses.text: Thy day when it had visited us and passed, and gone away, in its mercy returned and visited us again: for it knows that human nature needs it; in all things like unto Thee as seeking us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:5
verses.text: The world is in want of its fountain; and for it, Lord, as for Thee, all therein are athirst.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:6
verses.text: This is the day that rules over the seasons! the dominion of Thy day is like Thine, which stretches over generations that have come, and are to come! Thy day is like unto Thee, because when it is one, it buds and multiplies itself, that it may be like Thee!  In this Thy day, Lord, which is near unto us, we see Thy Birth that is far off! Like to Thee be Thy day to us, Lord; let it be a mediator and a warranter of peace.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:7
verses.text: Thy day reconciled Heaven and earth, because therein the Highest came down to the lowest.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:8
verses.text: Thy day was able to reconcile the Just One, who was wroth at our sins; Thy day forgave thousands of sins, for in it bowels of mercy shone forth upon the guilty!  Great, Lord, is Thy day; let it not be small upon us, let it show mercy according as it used to do, upon us transgressors!  And if every day, Lord, Thy forgiveness wells forth, how exceeding great should it be upon this day! All the days from the Treasure of Thy bright day gain blessings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:9
verses.text: All the feasts from the stores of this feast have their fairness and their ornaments.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:10
verses.text: Thy bowels of mercy upon Thy day make Thou to abound unto us, O Lord! Make us to distinguish Thy day from all days! for great is the treasure-house of the day of Thy Birth; let it be the ransomer of debtors! Great is this day above all days, for in it came forth mercy to sinners.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:11
verses.text: A store of medicines is this Thy great day, because on it shone forth the Medicine of Life to the wounded! A treasure of helpful graces is this day, for that on it Light gleamed forth upon our blindness! Yea, it also brought a sheaf unto us; and it came, that from it might flow plenty upon our hunger.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:12
verses.text: This day is that forerunning Cluster, in which the cup of salvation was concealed! This day is the first-born feast, which, being born the first, overcomes all feasts.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:13
verses.text: In the winter which strips the fruit of the branches off from the barren vine, Fruit sprang up unto us; in the cold that bares all the trees, a shoot was green for us of the house of Jesse.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:14
verses.text: In December when the seed is hidden in the earth, there sprouted forth from the Womb the Ear of Life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:15
verses.text: In March when the seed was sprouting in the air, a Sheaf sowed itself in the earth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:16
verses.text: The harvest thereof, Death devoured it in Hell; which the Medicine of life that is hidden therein did yet burst open! In March when the lambs bleat in the wilderness, into the Womb the Paschal Lamb entered! Out of the stream whence the fishers came up, He was baptized and came up Who incloses all things in his net; out of the stream the fish whereof Simon took, out of it the Fisher of men came up, and took him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:17
verses.text: With the Cross which catches all robbers, He caught up unto life that robber! The Living by His death emptied Hell, He unloosed it and let fly away from it entire multitudes! The publicans and harlots, the impure snares, the snares of the deceitful fowler the Holy One seized! The sinful woman, who was a snare for men, He made a mirror for penitent women! The fig that cast its fruit, that refused fruit, offered Zacchaeus as fruit; the fruit of its own nature it gave not, but it yielded one reasonable fruit! The Lord spread His thirst over the well, and caught her that was thirsty with the water that He asked of her.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:18
verses.text: He caught one soul at the well, and again caught with her the whole city: twelve fishers the Holy One caught, and again caught with them the whole world.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:19
verses.text: As for Iscariot, that escaped from His nets, the strangling halter fell upon his neck! His all-quickening net catches the living, and he that escapes from it escapes from the living.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:20
verses.text: And who is able, Lord, to tell me up the several succours that are hid in Thee? How shall the parched mouth be able to drink from the Fountain of the Godhead! Answer today the voice of our petition; let our prayer which is in words take effect in deeds.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:21
verses.text: Heal us, O my Master; every time that we see Thy Feast, may it cause rumours that we have heard to pass away.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:22
verses.text: Our mind wanders amid these voices.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:23
verses.text: O Voice of the Father, still [other] voices; the world is noisy, in Thee let it gain itself quiet; for by Thee the sea was stilled from its storms.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:24
verses.text: The devils rejoiced when they heard the voice of blasphemy: let the Watchers rejoice in us as they are wont.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:25
verses.text: From amongst Thy fold there is the voice of sorrowfulness; O Thou that makest all rejoice, let Thy flock rejoice! as for our murmur, O my Master, in it reject us not: our mouth murmurs since it is sinful.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:26
verses.text: Let Thy day, O Lord, give us all manner of joy, with the flowers of peace, let us keep Thy passover.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:27
verses.text: In the day of Thy Ascension we are lifted up: with the new Bread shall be the memorial thereof.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:28
verses.text: O Lord, increase our peace, that we may keep three feasts of the Godhead.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:29
verses.text: Great is Thy day, Lord, let us not be despised.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:30
verses.text: All men honour the day of Thy birth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:31
verses.text: Thou righteous One, keep Thou the glory of Thy birth; for even Herod honoured the day of His birth! The dances of the impure one pleased the tyrant; to Thee, Lord, let the voice of chaste women be sweet! Thee, Lord, let the voice of chaste women please, whose bodies Thou guardest holily.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:32
verses.text: The day of Herod was like him: Thy day too is like Thee! The day of the troubled one was troubled with sin; and fair as Thou art is Thy fair day! The feast of the tyrant killed the preacher; in Thy feast every man preaches glory.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:33
verses.text: On the day of the murderer, the Voice was put to silence; but on Thy day are the voices of the feast.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:34
verses.text: The foul one in his feast put out the Light, that darkness might cover the adulterers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:35
verses.text: The season of the Holy One trims lamps, that darkness may flee with the hidden things thereof.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:36
verses.text: The day of that fox stank like himself; but holy is the feast of the True Lamb.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:37
verses.text: The day of the transgressor passed away like himself; Thy day like Thyself abideth for ever.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:38
verses.text: The day of the tyrant raged like himself, because with his chain it put to silence the righteous Voice.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:39
verses.text: The feast of the Meek One is tranquil like Himself, because His sun shines upon His persecutors.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:40
verses.text: The tyrant was conscious that He was not a king, therefore to the King of kings he gave place.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:41
verses.text: The whole day, Lord, suffices me not to balance Thy praise with his blame.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:42
verses.text: May Thy Gracious day cause my sin to pass away, seeing that it is with the day of the impure one, that I have weighed Thy day! For great is Thy day beyond comparison! nor can it be compared with our days.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:43
verses.text: The day of man is as of the earthy: the day of God is as of God! Thy day, Lord, is greater than those of the prophets, and I have taken and set it beside that of the murderer! Thou knowest, O Lord, as knowing all things, how to hear the comparison that my tongue hath made.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:44
verses.text: Let Thy day grant our requests for life, since his day granted the request for death.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:45
verses.text: The needy king swore on his feast that half his kingdom should be the reward of the dance! Let Thy feast then, O Thou that enrichest all, shed down in mercy a crumb of fine wheat flour! From the dry land gushed the Fountain, which sufficed to satisfy the thirst of the Gentiles! From the Virgin's womb as from a strong rock sprouted up the seed, whence was much fruit! Barns without number did Joseph fill; and they were emptied and failed in the years of the famine.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:46
verses.text: One true Sheaf gave bread; the bread of Heaven, whereof there is no stint.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:47
verses.text: The bread which the First-born brake in the wilderness, failed and passed away though very good.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:48
verses.text: He returned again and broke the New Bread which ages and generations shall not waste away! The seven loaves also that He brake failed, and the five loaves too that He multiplied were consumed; the Bread that He brake exceeded the world's needs, for the more it was divided, the more it multiplied exceedingly.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:49
verses.text: With much wine also He filled the waterpots; they drew it out, yet it failed though it was abundant: of the Cup that He gave though the draught was small, very great was its strength, so that there is no stint thereto.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:50
verses.text: A Cup is He that contains all strong wines, and also a Mystery in the midst of which He Himself is! The one Bread that He brake has no bound, and the one Cup that He mingled has no stint! The Wheat that was sown, on the third day came up and filled the Garner of Life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:51
verses.text: The spiritual Bread, as the Giver of it, quickens the spiritual spiritually, and he that receives it carnally, receives it rashly to no profit.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:52
verses.text: This Bread of grace let the spirit receive discerningly, as the medicine of Life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:53
verses.text: If the dead sacrifices in the name of devils were offered, yea eaten, not without a mystery; at the holy thing of the offering, how much more does it behove us that this mystery be circumspectly administered by us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:54
verses.text: He that eateth of the sacrifice in the name of devils, becomes devilish without all contradiction.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:55
verses.text: He that eateth the Heavenly Bread, becomes Heavenly without doubt! Wine teaches us, in that it makes him that is familiar therewith like itself: for it hates much him that is fond of it, and is intoxicating and maddening, and a mocker to him! Light teaches us, in that it makes like unto itself the eye the daughter of the sun: the eye by the light saw the nakedness, and ran and chastely hid the chaste man.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:56
verses.text: As for that nakedness it was wine that made it, which even to the chaste skills not to show mercy!  With the weapon of the deceiver the First-born clad Himself, that with the weapon that killed, He might restore to life again! With the tree wherewith he slew us, He delivered us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:57
verses.text: With the wine which maddened us, with it we were made chaste! With the rib that was drawn out of Adam, the wicked one drew out the heart of Adam.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:58
verses.text: There rose from the Rib a hidden power, which cut off Satan as Dagon: for in that Ark a book was hidden that cried and proclaimed concerning the Conqueror! There was then a mystery revealed, in that Dagon was brought low in his own place of refuge! The accomplishment came after the type, in that the wicked one was brought low in the place in which he trusted! Blessed be He Who came and in Him were accomplished the mysteries of the left hand, and the right hand.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:59
verses.text: Fulfilled was the mystery that was in the Lamb, and fulfilled was the type that was in Dagon.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:60
verses.text: Blessed is He Who by the True Lamb redeemed us, and destroyed our destroyer as He did Dagon! In December when the nights are long, rose unto us the Day, of Whom there is no bound! In winter when all the world is gloomy, forth came the Fair One Who cheered all in the world! In winter that makes the earth barren, virginity learned to bring forth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:61
verses.text: In December, that causes the travails of the earth to cease, in it were the travails of virginity.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:62
verses.text: The early lamb no one ever used to see before the shepherds: and as for the true Lamb, in the season of His birth, the tidings of Him too hasted unto the shepherds.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:63
verses.text: That old wolf saw the sucking Lamb, and he trembled before Him, though He had concealed himself; for because the wolf had put on sheep's clothing, the Shepherd of all became a Lamb in the flocks, in order that when the greedy one had been bold against the Meek, the Mighty One might rend that Eater.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:64
verses.text: The Holy One dwelt bodily in the womb; and He dwelt spiritually in the mind.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:65
verses.text: Mary that conceived Him abhorred the marriage bed; let not that soul commit whoredom in the which He dwelleth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:66
verses.text: Because Mary perceived Him, she left her betrothed: He dwelleth in chaste virgins, if they perceive Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:67
verses.text: The deaf perceive not the mighty thunder, neither does the heady man the sound of the commandment.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:68
verses.text: For the deaf is bewildered in the time of the thunderclap, the heady man is bewildered also at the voice of instruction; if fearful thunder terrifies the deaf, then would fearful wrath stir the unclean! That the deaf hears not is no blame to him; but whoso tramples [on the commandments] it is headiness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:69
verses.text: From time to time there is thunder: but the voice of the law thunders every day.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:70
verses.text: Let us not close our ears when their openings, as being opened and not closed against it, accuse us; and the door of hearing is open by nature, that it might reproach us for our headiness against our will.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:71
verses.text: The door of the voice and the door of the mouth our will can open or close.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:72
verses.text: Let us see what the Good One has given us; and let us hear the mighty Voice, and let not the doors of our ears be closed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:73
verses.text: Glory to that Voice Which became Body, and to the Word of the High One Which became Flesh! Hear Him also, O ears, and see Him, O eyes, and feel Him, O hands, and eat Him, O mouth! Ye members and senses give praise unto Him, that came and quickened the whole body! Mary bare the silent Babe, while in Him were hidden all tongues! Joseph bare Him, and in Him was hidden a nature more ancient than aught that is old! The High One became as a little child, and in Him was hidden a treasure of wisdom sufficing for all! Though Most High, yet He sucked the milk of Mary, and of His goodness all creatures suck! He is the Breast of Life, and the Breath of Life; the dead suck from His life and revive.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:74
verses.text: Without the breath of the air no man lives, without the Might of the Son no man subsists.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:75
verses.text: On His living breath that quickeneth all, depend the spirits that are above and that are beneath.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:76
verses.text: When He sucked the milk of Mary, He was suckling all with Life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:77
verses.text: While He was lying on His Mother's bosom, in His bosom were all creatures lying.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:78
verses.text: He was silent as a Babe, and yet He was making His creatures execute all His commands.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:79
verses.text: For without the First-born no man can approach unto the Essence, to which He is equal.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:80
verses.text: The thirty years He was in the earth, Who was ordering all creatures, Who was receiving all the offerings of praise from those above and those below.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:81
verses.text: He was wholly in the depths and wholly in the highest! He was wholly with all things and wholly with each.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:82
verses.text: While His body was forming within the womb, His power was fashioning all members! While the Conception of the Son was fashioning in the womb, He Himself was fashioning babes in the womb.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:83
verses.text: Yet not as His body was weak in the womb, was His power weak in the womb! So too not as His body was feeble by the Cross, was His might also feeble by the Cross.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:84
verses.text: For when on the Cross He quickened the dead, His Body quickened them, yea, rather His Will; just as when He was dwelling wholly in the womb, His hidden Will was visiting all! For see how, when He was wholly hanging upon the Cross, His Power was yet making all creatures move! For He darkened the sun and made the earth quake; He rent the graves and brought forth the dead! See how when He was wholly on the Cross, yet again He was wholly everywhere! Thus was He entirely in the womb, while He was again wholly in everything! While on the Cross He quickened the dead, so while a Babe He was fashioning babes.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:85
verses.text: While He was slain, He opened the graves; while He was in the womb, He opened wombs.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:86
verses.text: Come hearken, my brethren, concerning the Son of the Secret One that was revealed in His Body, while His Power was concealed! For the Power of the Son is a free Power; the womb did not bind it up, as it did the Body! For while His Power was dwelling in the womb, He was fashioning infants in the womb! His Power compassed her, that compassed Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:87
verses.text: For if He drew in His Power, all things would fall; His Power upholds all things; while He was within the womb, He left not His hold of all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:88
verses.text: He in His own Person shaped an Image in the womb, and was shaping in all wombs all countenances.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:89
verses.text: Whilst He was increasing in stature among the poor, from an abundant treasury He was nourishing all! While she that anointed Him was anointing Him, with His dew and His rain He was anointing all! The Magi brought myrrh and gold, while in Him was hidden a treasure of riches.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:90
verses.text: The myrrh and spices which He had prepared and created, did the Magi bring Him of His own.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:91
verses.text: It was by Power from Him that Mary was able to bear in Her bosom Him that bears up all things! It was from the great storehouse of all creatures, Mary gave Him all which she did give Him! She gave Him milk from Himself that prepared it, she gave Him food from Himself that made it! He gave milk unto Mary as God: again He sucked it from her, as the Son of Man.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:92
verses.text: Her hands bare Him in that He had emptied His strength; and her arm embraced Him, in that He had made Himself small.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:93
verses.text: The measure of His Majesty who has measured? He caused His measures to shrink into a Raiment.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:94
verses.text: She wove for Him and clothed Him because He had put off His glory.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:95
verses.text: She measured Him and wove for Him, since He had made Himself little.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:96
verses.text: The sea when it bore Him was still and calmed, and how came the lap of Joseph to bear Him? The womb of hell conceived Him and was burst open, and how did the womb of Mary contain Him? The stone that was over the grave He broke open by His might, and how could Mary's arm contain Him? Thou camest to a low estate, that Thou mightest raise all to life! Glory be unto Thee from all that are quickened by Thee! Who is able to speak of the Son of the Hidden One who came down and clothed Himself with a Body in the womb? He came forth and sucked milk as a child, and among little children the Son of the Lord of all crept about.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:97
verses.text: They saw Him as a little Child in the street, while there was dwelling in Him the Love of all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:98
verses.text: Visibly children surrounded Him in the street; secretly Angels surrounded Him in fear.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:99
verses.text: Cheerful was He with the little ones as a child; awful was He with the Angels as a Commander: He was awful to John for him to loose His shoe's latchet: He was gentle to sinners that kissed His feet! The Angels as Angels saw Him; according to the measure of his knowledge each man beheld Him: according to the measure of each man's discernment, thus he perceived Him that is greater than all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:100
verses.text: The Father and Himself alone are a full measure of knowledge so as know Him as He is! For every creature whether above or below obtains each his measure of knowledge; He the Lord of all gives all to us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:101
verses.text: He that enriches all, requires usury of all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:102
verses.text: He gives to all things as wanting nothing, and yet requires usury of all as if needy.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:103
verses.text: He gave us herds and flocks as Creator, and yet asked sacrifices as though in need.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:104
verses.text: He made the water wine as Maker: and yet he drank of it as a poor man.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:105
verses.text: Of His own He mingled [wine] in the marriage feast, His wine He mingled and gave to drink when He was a guest.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:106
verses.text: In His love He multiplied [the days of] the aged Simeon; that he, a mortal, might present Him who quickeneth all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:107
verses.text: By power from Him did Simeon carry Him; he that presented Him, was by Him presented [to God].

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:108
verses.text: He gave imposition of hands to Moses in the Mount, and received it in the midst of the river from John.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:109
verses.text: In the power of His gifts John was enabled to baptize, though earthy, the heavenly.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:110
verses.text: By power from Him the earth supported Him: it was nigh to being dissolved, and His might strengthened it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:111
verses.text: Martha gave Him to eat: viands which He had created she placed before Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 3:112
verses.text: Of His own all that give have made their vows: of His own treasures they placed upon His table.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:1
verses.text: Hymn IV.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:2
verses.text: This is the month which brings all manner of joy; it is the freedom of the bondsmen, the pride of the free, the crown of the gates, the soothing of the body, that also in its love put purple upon us as upon kings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:3
verses.text: This is the month that brings all manner of victories; it frees the spirit; it subdues the body; it brings forth life among mortals; it caused, in its love, Godhead, to dwell in Manhood.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:4
verses.text: In this day the Lord exchanged glory for shame, as being humble; because Adam changed the truth for unrighteousness as being a rebel: the Good One had mercy on him, justified and set right them that had turned aside.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:5
verses.text: Let every man chase away his weariness, since that Majesty was not wearied with being in the womb nine months for us, and in being thirty years in Sodom among the madmen.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:6
verses.text: Because the Good One saw that the race of man was poor and humbled, He made feasts as a treasure-house, and opened them to the slothful, that the feast might stir up the slothful one to rise and be rich.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:7
verses.text: Lo! the First-born has opened unto us His feast as a treasure-house.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:8
verses.text: This one day in the whole year alone opens that treasure-house: come, let us make gain, let us grow rich from it, ere they shut it up.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:9
verses.text: Blessed be the watchful, that have taken by force from it the spoil of Life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:10
verses.text: It is a great disgrace, when a man sees his neighbor take and carry out treasure, and himself sits in the treasure-house slumbering, so as to come forth empty.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:11
verses.text: In this feast, let each one of us crown the gates of his heart.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:12
verses.text: The Holy Spirit longs for the gates thereof, that He may enter in and dwell there, and sanctify it, and He goes round about to all the gates to see where He may enter.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:13
verses.text: In this feast, the gates are glad before the gates, and the Holy One rejoices in the holy temple, and the voice resounds in the mouth of children, and Christ rejoices in His own feast as a mighty man.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:14
verses.text: At the Birth of the Son the king was enrolling all men for the tribute-money, that they might be debtors to Him: the King came forth to us Who blotted out our bills, and wrote another bill in His own Name that He might be our debtor.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:15
verses.text: The sun gave longer light, and foreshadowed the mystery by the degrees which it had gone up.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:16
verses.text: It was twelve days since it had gone up, and to-day is the thirteenth day: a type exact of the Son's birth and of His Twelve.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:17
verses.text: Moses shut up a lamb in the month Nisan on the tenth day; a type this of the Son that came into the womb and shut Himself up therein on the tenth day.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:18
verses.text: He came forth from the womb in this month in which the sun gives longer light.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:19
verses.text: The darkness was overcome, that it might proclaim that Satan was overcome; and the sun gave longer light, that it might triumph, because the First-born was victorious.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:20
verses.text: Along with the darkness the dark one was overcome, and with the greater light our Light conquered!  Joseph caressed the Son as a Babe; he ministered to Him as God.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:21
verses.text: He rejoiced in Him as in the Good One, and he was awe-struck at Him as the Just One, greatly bewildered.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:22
verses.text: "Who hath given me the Son of the Most High to be a Son to me? I was jealous of Thy Mother, and I thought to put her away, and I knew not that in her womb was hidden a mighty treasure, that should suddenly enrich my poor estate.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:23
verses.text: David the king sprang of my race, and wore the crown: and I have come to a very low estate, who instead of a king am a carpenter.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:24
verses.text: Yet a crown hath come to me, for in my bosom is the Lord of crowns!"  With rival words Mary burned, yea she lulled Him, [saying,] Who hath given me, the barren, that I should conceive and bring forth this One, that is manifold; a little One, that is great; for that He is wholly with me, and wholly everywhere?  The day that Gabriel came in unto my low estate, he made me free instead of a handmaid, of a sudden: for I was the handmaid of Thy Divine Nature, and am also the Mother of Thy human Nature, O Lord and Son!  Of a sudden the handmaid became the King's daughter in Thee, Thou Son of the King.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:25
verses.text: Lo, the meanest in the house of David, by reason of Thee, Thou Son of David, lo, a daughter of earth hath attained unto Heaven by the Heavenly One!  How am I astonied that there is laid before me a Child, older than all things! His eye is gazing unceasingly upon Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:26
verses.text: As for the stammering of His mouth, to my seeming it betokens, that with God its silence speaks.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:27
verses.text: Who ever saw a Child the whole of Whom beholdeth every place? His look is like one that orders all creatures that are above and that are below! His visage is like that Commander that commandeth all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:28
verses.text: How shall I open the fountain of milk to Thee, O Fountain? Or how shall I give nourishment to Thee that nourishest all from Thy Table? How shall I bring to swaddling clothes One wrapped round with rays of glory?  My mouth knows not how I shall call Thee, O Thou Child of the Living One: for to venture to call Thee as the Child of Joseph, I tremble, since Thou art not his seed: and I am fearful of denying the name of him to whom they have betrothed me.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:29
verses.text: While Thou art the Son of One, then should I be calling Thee the Son of many.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:30
verses.text: For ten thousand names would not suffice Thee, since Thou art the Son of God and also the Son of man, yea, David's Son and Mary's Lord.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:31
verses.text: Who hath made the Lord of mouths to be without a mouth? For my pure conception of Thee wicked men have slandered me.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:32
verses.text: Be, O Thou Holy One, a Speaker for Thy Mother.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:33
verses.text: Show a miracle that they may be persuaded, from Whom it is that I conceived Thee!  For Thy sake too I am hated, Thou Lover of all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:34
verses.text: Lo! I am persecuted who have conceived and brought forth One House of refuge for men.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:35
verses.text: Adam will rejoice, for Thou art the Key of Paradise.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:36
verses.text: Lo, the sea raged against Thy mother as against Jonah.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:37
verses.text: Lo, Herod, that raging wave, sought to drown the Lord of the seas.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:38
verses.text: Whither I shall flee Thou shalt teach me, O Lord of Thy Mother.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:39
verses.text: With Thee I will flee, that I may gain in Thee Life in every place.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:40
verses.text: The prison with Thee is no prison, for in Thee man goes up unto Heaven: the grave with Thee is no grave, for Thou art the Resurrection! A star of light which was not nature, shone forth suddenly; less than the sun and greater than the sun, less than it in its visible light, but greater than it in its hidden might, by reason of its mystery.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:41
verses.text: The Morning Star cast its bright beams among the darknesses, and led them as blind men, and they came and received a great light: they gave offerings and received life, and they worshipped and returned.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:42
verses.text: In the height and the depth two preachers were there to the Son: the bright star shouted above; John also preached below, two preachers, an earthly and a heavenly.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:43
verses.text: That above showed His Nature to be from the Majesty, and that below too showed his Nature to be from mankind.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:44
verses.text: O great marvel, that His Godhead and His Manhood each was preached by them.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:45
verses.text: Whoso thought Him earthly, the bright star convinced him that He was heavenly; and whoso thought Him spiritual, John convinced him that He was also corporeal.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:46
verses.text: In the Holy temple Simeon carried Him, and lulled Him, [saying,] "Thou art come, O Merciful One, showing mercy on my old age, making my bones to go into the grave in peace.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:47
verses.text: In Thee shall I be raised from the grave into Paradise!"  Anna embraced Him, and put her mouth to His lips, and the Spirit dwelt upon her own lips.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:48
verses.text: As when Isaiah's mouth was silent, the coal which approached his lips opened his mouth; so Anna burned with the Spirit of His mouth, yea, she lulled Him, [saying,] "Son of the Kingdom, Son of the lowliness, that hearest and art still, that seest and art hidden, that knowest and art unknown, God, Son of Man, glory be unto Thy Name".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:49
verses.text: The barren also heard, ran, and came with their provisions: the Magi came with their treasures, the barren came with their provisions.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:50
verses.text: Provisions and riches were suddenly heaped up in the house of the poor.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:51
verses.text: The barren woman cried out, as at that which she looked not for, Who hath granted me this sight of thy Babe, O Blessed One, by whom the heaven and earth are filled! Blessed be thy Fruit, which made the barren vine to bear a cluster.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:52
verses.text: Zacharias came and opened his venerable mouth and cried, "Where is the King, for whose sake I have begotten the Voice that is to preach before His face? Hail, Son of the King, to whom also our Priesthood shall be given up!"  John approached with his parents and worshipped the Son, and He shed glory upon his countenance; and he was not moved as when in the womb! Mighty miracle, that here he was worshipping, there he leaped.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:53
verses.text: Herod also, that base fox, that stalked about like a lion, as a fox crouched down, and howled, when he heard the roaring of the Lion, who came to sit in the kingdom according to the Scriptures.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:54
verses.text: The fox heard that the Lion was a whelp, and as a suckling; and he sharpened His teeth, that while He was yet a child the fox might lie in wait and devour the Lion ere He had grown up, and the breath of His mouth should destroy him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:55
verses.text: The whole creation became mouths to Him, and cried concerning Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:56
verses.text: The Magi cried by their offerings! the barren cried with their children, the star of light cried in that air, lo! the Son of the King!  The Heavens were opened, the waters were calmed, the Dove glorified Him, the voice of the Father, louder than thunder, was instant and said, This is my beloved Son.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:57
verses.text: The Angels proclaim Him, the children shout to Him with their Hosannas.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:58
verses.text: These voices above and below proclaim Him and cry aloud.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 4:59
verses.text: The slumber of Sion was not dispersed by the voice of the thunders, but she was offended, stood up, and slew Him because He aroused her.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:1
verses.text: Hymn V.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:2
verses.text: At the birth of the Son, there was a great shouting in Bethlehem; for the Angels came down, and gave praise there.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:3
verses.text: Their voices were a great thunder: at that voice of praise the silent ones came, and gave praise to the Son.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:4
verses.text: Blessed be that Babe in whom Eve and Adam were restored to youth! The shepherds also came laden with the best gifts of their flock: sweet milk, clean flesh, befitting praise! They put a difference, and gave Joseph the flesh, Mary the milk, and the Son the praise! They brought and presented a suckling lamb to the Paschal Lamb, a first-born to the First-born, a sacrifice to the Sacrifice, a lamb of time to the Lamb of Truth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:5
verses.text: Fair sight [to see] the lamb offered to The Lamb!  The lamb bleated as it was offered before the First-born.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:6
verses.text: It praised the Lamb, that had come to set free the flocks and the oxen from sacrifices: yea that Paschal Lamb, Who handed down and brought in the Passover of the Son.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:7
verses.text: The shepherds came near and worshipped Him with their staves.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:8
verses.text: They saluted Him with peace, prophesying the while, "Peace, O Prince of the Shepherds".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:9
verses.text: The rod of Moses praised Thy Rod, O Shepherd of all; for Thee Moses praises, although his lambs have become wolves, and his flocks as it were dragons, and his sheep fanged beasts.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:10
verses.text: In the fearful wilderness his flocks became furious, and attacked him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:11
verses.text: Thee then the Shepherds praise, because Thou hast reconciled the wolves and the lambs within the fold; O Babe, that art older than Noah and younger than Noah, that reconciled all within the ark amid the billows!  David Thy father for a lamb's sake slaughtered a lion.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:12
verses.text: Thou, O Son of David, hast killed the unseen wolf that murdered Adam, the simple lamb who fed and bleated in Paradise.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:13
verses.text: At that voice of praise, brides were moved to hallow themselves, and virgins to be chaste, and even young girls became grave: they advanced and came in multitudes, and worshipped the Son.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:14
verses.text: Aged women of the city of David came to the daughter of David; they gave thanks and said, "Blessed be our country, whose streets are lightened with the rays of Jesse! Today is the throne of David established by Thee, O Son of David".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:15
verses.text: The old men cried, "Blessed be that Son Who restored Adam to youth, Who was vexed to see that he was old and worn out, and that the serpent who had killed him, had changed his skin and had gotten himself away.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:16
verses.text: Blessed be the Babe in Whom Adam and Eve were restored to youth".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:17
verses.text: The chaste women said, O Blessed Fruit, bless the fruit of our wombs; to Thee may they be given as first-born.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:18
verses.text: They waxed fervent and prophesied concerning their children, who, when they were killed for Him, were cut off, as it were first-fruits.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 5:19
verses.text: The barren also fondled Him, and carried Him; they rejoiced and said, Blessed Fruit born without marriage, bless the wombs of us that are married; have mercy on our barrenness, Thou wonderful Child of Virginity!.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:1
verses.text: Hymn VI.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:2
verses.text: Blessed be the Messenger that was laden, and came; a great peace! The Bowels of the Father brought Him down to us; He did not bring up our debts to Him, but made a satisfaction to that Majesty with His own goods.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:3
verses.text: Praised be the Wise One, who reconciled and joined the Divine with the Human Nature.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:4
verses.text: One from above and one from below, He confined the Natures as medicines, and being the Image of God, became man.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:5
verses.text: That Jealous One when He saw that Adam was dust, and that the cursed serpent had devoured him, shed soundness into that which was tasteless, and made him [as] salt, wherewith the accursed serpent should be blinded.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:6
verses.text: Blessed be the Merciful One, who saw the weapon by Paradise, that closed the way to the Tree of Life; and came and took a Body which could suffer, that with the Door, that was in His side, He might open the way into Paradise.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:7
verses.text: Blessed be that Merciful One, who lent not Himself to harshness, but without constraint conquered by wisdom; that He might give an ensample unto men, that by virtue and wisdom they might conquer discerningly.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:8
verses.text: Blessed is Thy flock, since Thou art the gate thereof, and Thou art the staff thereof.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:9
verses.text: Thou art the Shepherd thereof, Thou art the Drink thereof, Thou art the salt thereof, yea, the Visitor thereof.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:10
verses.text: Hail to the Only-Begotten, that bare abundantly all manner of consolations!  The husbandmen came and did obeisance before the Husbandman of Life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:11
verses.text: They prophesied to Him as they rejoiced, [saying,] "Blessed be the Husbandman, by Whom the ground of the heart is tilled, Who gathereth His wheat into the garner of Life".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:12
verses.text: The husbandmen came and gave glory to the Vineyard that sprang of the root and stem of Jesse, the Virgin Cluster of the glorious Vine.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:13
verses.text: "May we be vessels for Thy new Wine that renews all things".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:14
verses.text: "In Thee may the Vineyard of my Well-beloved that yielded wild grapes find peace! Graft its vines from Thy stocks; let it be laden entirely from Thy blessings with a fruit which may reconcile the Lord of the Vineyard, Who threatens it".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:15
verses.text: Because of Joseph the workmen came to the Son of Joseph saying, "Blessed be Thy Nativity, Thou Head of Workmen, the impress whereof the ark bore, after which was fashioned the Tabernacle of the congregation that was for a time only!"  "Our craft praises Thee, Who art our glory.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:16
verses.text: Make Thou the yoke which is light, yea easy, for them that bear it; make the measure, in which there can be no falseness, which is full of Truth; yea, devise and make measures by righteousness; that he that is vile may be accused thereby, and he that is perfect, may be acquitted thereby.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:17
verses.text: Weigh therewith both mercy and truth, O just One, as a judge".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:18
verses.text: "Bridegrooms with their brides rejoiced.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:19
verses.text: Blessed be the Babe, whose Mother was Bride of the Holy One! Blessed the marriage feast, whereat Thou wast present, in which when wine was suddenly wanting, in Thee it abounded again!"  The children cried out, "Blessed He that hath become unto us a Brother, and Companion in the midst of the streets.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:20
verses.text: Blessed be the day which by the Branches gives glory to the Tree of life, that made His Majesty be brought low, to our childish age!"  Women heard that a Virgin should conceive and bring forth a Son: honourable women hoped that thou wouldest rise from them; yea noble ladies that Thou mightest spring up from them! Blessed be Thy Majesty, that humbled Itself, and rose from the poor!  Yea the young girls that carried Him prophesied, saying, "Whether I be hated or fair, or of low estate, I am without spot for Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:21
verses.text: I have taken Thee in charge for the bed of Childbirth".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:22
verses.text: Sarah had lulled Isaac, who as a slave bare the Image of the King his Master on his shoulders, even the sign of His Cross; yea, on his hands were bandages and sufferings, a type of the nails.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:23
verses.text: Rachel cried to her husband, and said, Give me sons.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:24
verses.text: Blessed be Mary, in whose womb, though she asked not, Thou didst dwell holily, O Gift, that poured itself upon them that received it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:25
verses.text: Hannah with bitter tears asked a child; Sarah and Rebecca with vows and words, Elizabeth also with her prayer, after having vexed themselves for a long time, yet so obtained comfort.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:26
verses.text: Blessed be Mary, who without vows and without prayer, in her Virginity conceived and brought forth the Lord of all the sons of her companions, who have been or shall be chaste and righteous, priests and kings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 6:27
verses.text: Who else lulled a son in her bosom as Mary did? who ever dared to call her son, Son of the Maker, Son of the Creator, Son of the Most High?  Who ever dared to speak to her son as in prayer? O Trust of Thy Mother as God, her Beloved and her Son as Man, in fear and love it is meet for thy Mother to stand before Thee!.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:1
verses.text: Hymn VII.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:2
verses.text: The Son of the Maker is like unto His Father as Maker! He made Himself a pure body, He clothed Himself with it, and came forth and clothed our weakness with glory, which in His mercy He brought from the Father.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:3
verses.text: From Melchizedek, the High Priest, a hyssop came to Thee, a throne and crown from the house of David, a race and family from Abraham.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:4
verses.text: Be thou unto me a Haven, for Thine own sake, O great Sea.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:5
verses.text: Lo! the Psalms of David Thy Father, and the words also of the Prophets, came forth unto me, as it were ships.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:6
verses.text: David Thy father, in the hundred and tenth Psalm, twined together two numbers as it were crowns to Thee, and came [to Thee], O Conqueror! With these shalt Thou be crowned, and unto the throne shalt Thou ascend and sit.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:7
verses.text: A great crown is the number that is twined in the hundred, wherein is crowned Thy Godhead! A little crown is that of the number ten, which crowns the Head of Thy Manhood, O Victorious One!  For Thy sake women sought after men.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:8
verses.text: Tamar desired him that was widowed, and Ruth loved a man that was old, yea, that Rahab, that led men captive, was captivated by Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:9
verses.text: Tamar went forth, and in the darkness stole the Light, and in uncleanness stole the Holy One, and by uncovering her nakedness she went in and stole Thee, O glorious One, that bringest the pure out of the impure.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:10
verses.text: Satan saw her and trembled, and hasted to trouble her.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:11
verses.text: He brought the judgment to her mind, and she feared not; stoning and the sword, and she trembled not.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:12
verses.text: He that teacheth adultery hindered adultery, because he was a hinderer of Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:13
verses.text: For holy was the adultery of Tamar, for Thy sake.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:14
verses.text: Thee it was she thirsted after, O pure Fountain.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:15
verses.text: Judah defrauded her of drinking Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:16
verses.text: The thirsty womb stole a dew-draught of Thee from the spring thereof.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:17
verses.text: She was a widow for Thy sake.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:18
verses.text: Thee did she long for, she hasted and was also an harlot for Thy sake.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:19
verses.text: Thee did she vehemently desire, and was sanctified in that it was Thee she loved.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:20
verses.text: May Tamar rejoice that her Lord hath come and hath made her name known for the son of her adultery! Surely the name she gave him was calling unto Thee to come to her.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:21
verses.text: For Thee honorable women shamed themselves, Thou that givest chastity to all! Thee she stole away in the midst of the ways, who pavest the way into the kingdom! Because it was life that she stole, the sword was not able to put her to death.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:22
verses.text: Ruth lay down by a man in the threshingfloor for Thy sake; her love made her bold for Thy sake, O Thou that teachest all penitents boldness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:23
verses.text: Her ears refused [to listen to] any voices for the sake of Thy voice.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:24
