verses.text: The live coal that glowed went up into the bed, of Boaz, lay down there, saw the High Priest, in whose loins was hidden a fire for his incense! She hasted and was a heifer to Boaz, that should bring forth Thee, the fatted Calf.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:25
verses.text: She went gleaning for her love of Thee; she gathered straw.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 7:26
verses.text: Thou didst quickly pay her the reward of her lowliness; and instead of ears of corn, the Root of Kings, and instead of straws, the Sheaf of Life, didst Thou make to spring from her.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:1
verses.text: Hymn VIII.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:2
verses.text: That Thy Resurrection might be believed among the gainsayers, they sealed Thee up within the sepulchre, and set guards; for it was for Thee that they sealed the sepulchre and set guards, O Son of the Living One!  When they had buried Thee, if they had neglected Thee and left Thee, and gone, there would have been room to lie [and say] that they did steal, O Quickener of all! When they craftily sealed Thy sepulchre, they made Thy Glory greater.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:3
verses.text: A type of Thee therefore was Daniel, and also Lazarus; one in the den, which the Gentiles sealed up, and one in the sepulchre, that the People opened.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:4
verses.text: Lo! their signs and their seals reproved them.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:5
verses.text: Their mouth had been open, if they had left Thy sepulchre open.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:6
verses.text: But they went away because they had shut Thy sepulchre and sealed it, and closed up their own mouths.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:7
verses.text: Yea they closed it, and when they had senselessly covered Thy sepulchre, all the slanderers covered their own heads.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:8
verses.text: But in Thy Resurrection Thou persuadest them concerning Thy Birth; since the womb was sealed, and the sepulchre closed up; being alike pure in the womb, and living in the sepulchre.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:9
verses.text: The womb and the sepulchre being sealed were witnesses unto Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:10
verses.text: The belly and hell cried aloud of Thy Birth and Thy Resurrection: The belly conceived Thee, which was sealed; hell brought Thee forth which was closed up.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:11
verses.text: Not after nature did either the belly conceive Thee, or hell give Thee up!  Sealed was the sepulchre whereto they had entrusted Thee, that it might keep the dead [safe], Virgin was the womb which no man knew.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:12
verses.text: Virgin womb and sealed sepulchre, like trumpets, proclaimed Him in the ears of a deaf people.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:13
verses.text: The sealed belly and the closed rock were amongst the accusers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:14
verses.text: For they slandered the Conception as being of the seed of man, and the Resurrection as being of the robbery of man; the seal and the signet convicted them, and pleaded that Thou wert of Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:15
verses.text: The people stood between Thy Birth and Thy Resurrection.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:16
verses.text: They slandered Thy Birth, Thy Death condemned them: they set aside Thy Resurrection, Thy Birth refuted them; they were two wrestlers that stopped the mouth that slandered.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:17
verses.text: For Elijah they went and searched the mountains: as they sought him on earth, they the more confirmed that he was taken up.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:18
verses.text: Their searching bare witness that he was taken up, in that it found him not.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:19
verses.text: If then prophets that had had forewarning of Elijah's ascension, doubted as it were of his going up, how much more would impure men speak slander of the Son? By their own guards He convinced them that He was risen again.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:20
verses.text: To Thy Mother, Lord, no man knew what name to give.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:21
verses.text: Should he call her Virgin, her Child stood [there]; and married no man knew her to be! If then none comprehended Thy Mother, who shall suffice for Thee?  For she was, alone, Thy Mother; along with all, Thy Sister.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:22
verses.text: She was Thy mother, she was Thy Sister.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:23
verses.text: She along with chaste women was Thy betrothed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:24
verses.text: With everything didst Thou adorn Her, Thou ornament of Thy Mother.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:25
verses.text: For she was Thy Bride by nature ere Thou hadst come; she conceived Thee not by nature after Thou wast come, O Holy One, and was a Virgin when she had brought Thee forth holily.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:26
verses.text: Mary gained in Thee, O Lord, the honours of all married women.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:27
verses.text: She conceived [Thee] within her without marriage.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:28
verses.text: There was milk in her breasts, not after the way of nature.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:29
verses.text: Thou madest the thirsty land suddenly a fountain of milk.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:30
verses.text: If she carried Thee, Thy mighty look made her burden light; if she gave Thee to eat, it was because Thou wert hungry; if she gave Thee to drink [it was], because Thou wert thirsty; willingly if she embraced Thee, Thou, the coal of mercies, didst keep her bosom safe.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:31
verses.text: A wonder is Thy Mother.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:32
verses.text: The Lord entered her, and became a servant: the Word entered her, and became silent within her; thunder entered her, and His voice was still: the Shepherd of all entered her; He became a Lamb in her, and came forth bleating.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:33
verses.text: The Belly of Thy Mother changed the order of things, O Thou that orderest all! The rich went in, He came out poor: the High One went in, He came out lowly.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:34
verses.text: Brightness went into her and clothed Himself, and came forth a despised form.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:35
verses.text: The Mighty went in, and clad Himself with fear from the Belly.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:36
verses.text: He that giveth food to all went in, and gat hunger.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:37
verses.text: He that giveth all to drink went in, and gat thirst.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:38
verses.text: Naked and bare came forth from her the Clother of all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:39
verses.text: The daughters of the Hebrews that cried in the Lamentations of Jeremiah, instead of lamentations of their Scriptures, used lulling-songs from their own books: a hidden Power within their words was prophesying.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:40
verses.text: Eve lifted up her eyes from Sheol and rejoiced in that day, because the Son of her daughter as a medicine of life came down to raise up the mother of His mother.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:41
verses.text: Blessed Babe, that bruised the head of the Serpent that smote her!  She saw the type of Thee from the youth of Isaac the fair.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:42
verses.text: For Thee Sarah, as seeing that types of thee rested on his childhood, called him, saying, O child of my vows, in whom is hidden the Lord of vows.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:43
verses.text: Samson the Nazarite shadowed forth a type of Thy working.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:44
verses.text: He tore the lion, the image of death, whom Thou didst destroy, and caused to go forth from his bitterness the sweetness of life for men.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:45
verses.text: Hannah also embraced Samuel; for Thy righteousness was hidden in him who hewed in pieces Agag as [a type] of the wicked one.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:46
verses.text: He wept over Saul, because Thy goodness also was shadowed forth in him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:47
verses.text: How meek art Thou! How mighty art Thou, O Child! Thy judgment is mighty, Thy love is sweet! Who can stand against Thee? Thy Father is in Heaven, Thy Mother is on earth; who shall declare Thee? If a man should seek after Thy Nature, it is hidden in Heaven in the mighty Bosom of the Godhead; and if a man seek after Thy visible Body, it is laid down before their eyes in the lowly bosom of Mary.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:48
verses.text: The mind wanders between Thy generations, O Thou Rich One! Thick folds are upon Thy Godhead.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:49
verses.text: Who can sound Thy depths, Thou great Sea that made itself little?  We come to see Thee as God, and, lo! Thou art a man: we come to see Thee as man, and there shineth forth the Light of Thy Godhead!  Who would believe that Thou art the Heir of David's Throne? A manger hast Thou inherited out of [all] his beds, a cave has come down to Thee out of all his palaces.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:50
verses.text: Instead of his chariots a common ass's colt, perchance, comes down to Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:51
verses.text: How fearless art Thou, O Babe, that dost let all have thee [to carry]: upon every one that meets with Thee dost Thou smile: to every one that sees Thee, art Thou glad-some! Thy love is as one that hungers after men.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:52
verses.text: Thou makest no distinction between Thy fathers and strangers, nor Thy Mother and maidservants, nor her that suckled Thee and the unclean.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:53
verses.text: Was it Thy forwardness or Thy love, O Thou that lovest all?  What moves Thee that Thou didst let all that saw Thee have Thee, both rich and poor? Thou helpedst them that called Thee not.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:54
verses.text: Whence came it that Thou hungeredst so for men?  How great was Thy love, that if one rebuked Thee, Thou wast not wroth! if a man threatened Thee, Thou wast not terrified! if one hissed at Thee, Thou didst not feel vexed! Thou art above the laws of the avengers of injuries.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:55
verses.text: Moses was meek, and [yet] his zeal was harsh, for he struggled and slew.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:56
verses.text: Elisha also, who restored a child to life, tore a multitude of children in pieces by bears.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:57
verses.text: Who art Thou, O Child, whose love is greater than that of the Prophets?  The son of Hagar who was wild, kicked at Isaac.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:58
verses.text: He bore it and was silent, and his mother was jealous.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 8:59
verses.text: Art Thou the mystery of him, or is not he the type of Thee? art thou like Isaac, or is it not he that is like Thee?.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:1
verses.text: Hymn IX.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:2
verses.text: Come rest, and be still in the bosom of Thy Mother, Son of the Glorious.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:3
verses.text: Forwardness fits not the sons of kings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:4
verses.text: O Son of David, Thou art glorious, and [yet] the Son of Mary, who dost hide Thy beauty in the inner chamber.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:5
verses.text: To whom art Thou like, glad Babe, fair little One, Whose Mother is a Virgin, Whose Father is hidden, Whom even the Seraphim are not able to look upon? Tell us whom Thou art like, O Son of the Gracious!  When the wrathful came to see Thee, Thou madest them gladsome: they exchanged smiles one with another: the angry were made gentle in Thee, O sweet One.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:6
verses.text: Blessed art Thou, little One, for that in Thee even the bitter are made sweet.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:7
verses.text: Who ever saw a Babe that was gladsome when in arms to those that came near him, lo! reached Himself unto them that were far off? Fair sight [to see] a Child, that takes thought for every man that they may see him!  He that hath care came and saw Thee, and his care fled away.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:8
verses.text: He that had anxiety; at Thee forgat his anxiety; the hungry by Thee forgat his victuals; and he that had an errand, by Thee was errant and forgot his journey!  O still Thyself, and let men go to their works! Thou art a son of the poor, learn from Thyself that all the poor had to leave their work to come.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:9
verses.text: Thou who lovest men, hast bound men together by Thy gladsomeness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:10
verses.text: David, that stately king, took branches, and in the feast amongst the children as he danced, he gave praise.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:11
verses.text: Is it not the love of David Thy father that is warm in Thee?  That daughter of Saul! her father's devil spake in her: she called the stately [king] a vile fellow, because he gave an ensample to the elders of her people of taking up branches with the children in the day of praise to Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:12
verses.text: Who would not fear to lay it to Thee that Thou art forward? For lo, the daughter of Saul who mocked the child, cut off her womb from childbearing; because her mouth derided, the reward of its mouth was barrenness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:13
verses.text: Let mouths tremble at blasphemy, lest they be shut up! Refrain, O daughter of Sion, thy mouth from Him, for He is the Son of David, Who is gladsome before thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:14
verses.text: Be not unto Him as the daughter of Saul, whose race is extinct.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:15
verses.text: Because Elijah restrained the desire of the body, he withheld rain from the adulterous; because he kept under his body, he withheld dew from the whoremongers, who let their fountains be loosely poured out.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:16
verses.text: Because the hidden fire of the lust of the body ruled not in him, to him the fire from on high was obedient.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:17
verses.text: And since he subdued on the earth the lust of the flesh, he went up thither where holiness dwells and is at peace.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:18
verses.text: Elisha also who deadened his own body, quickened the dead.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:19
verses.text: The resurrection of the dead was in the usual course by a sanctification not in the usual course; He raised the child, because he purified his soul like a weaned child.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:20
verses.text: Moses, who divided and separated himself from his wife, divided the sea before the harlot.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 9:21
verses.text: Zipporah though daughter of a heathen priest kept sanctity: with a calf the daughter of Abraham went a whoring.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:1
verses.text: Hymn X.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:2
verses.text: In Thee will I begin to speak, Thou Head that didst begin all created things.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:3
verses.text: I, even I will open my mouth, but it is Thou that fillest my mouth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:4
verses.text: I am the earth to Thee, and Thou art the husbandman.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:5
verses.text: Sow Thy voice in me, Thou that sowedst Thyself in the womb of thy Mother.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:6
verses.text: "All the chaste daughters of the Hebrews, and the virgins' daughters of the chief men, are astonished at me! For Thee doth the daughter of the poor meet with envy, for Thee, the daughter of the weak with jealousy.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:7
verses.text: Who hath given Thee to me?  "O Son of the Rich One, Who abhorred the bosom of the rich women, who led Thee to the poor? for Joseph was needy and I also in want, yet Thy merchants have come, and brought gold, to the house of the poor".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:8
verses.text: She saw the Magi: her songs increased at their offerings; "Lo! Thy worshippers have surrounded me, yea thy offerings have encircled me.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:9
verses.text: Blessed be the Babe who made His Mother a harp for His words:  "And as the harp waiteth for its master, my mouth waiteth for Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:10
verses.text: May the tongue of Thy Mother bring what pleases Thee; and since I have learnt a new Conception by Thee, let my mouth learn in Thee, O new born Son, a new song of praise.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:11
verses.text: "And if hindrances are no hindrances to Thee, since difficulties are easy to Thee, as a womb without marriage conceived Thee, and a belly without seed brought Thee forth, it is easy for a little mouth to multiply Thy great glory.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:12
verses.text: "Lo! I am oppressed and despised, and yet cheerful: mine ears are filled with reproof and scorn; and it is a small thing to me to bear, for ten thousand troubles can a single comfort of Thine chase away.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:13
verses.text: "And since I am not despised by Thee, O Son, my countenance is bright; and I am slandered for having conceived, and yet have brought forth the Truth who justifies me.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:14
verses.text: For if Tamar was justified by Judah, how much more shall I be justified by Thee!"  David Thy father sung in a psalm of Thee before Thou hadst come, that to Thee should be given the gold of Sheba.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:15
verses.text: This psalm that he sung of Thee, lo! it, whilst Thou art yet a child, in reality heaps before thee myrrh and gold.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 10:16
verses.text: And the hundred and fifty Psalms that he wrote, in Thee were seasoned, because all the sayings of prophecy stood in need of Thy sweetness, for without Thy salt all manner of wisdom were tasteless.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:1
verses.text: Hymn XI.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:2
verses.text: (The Virgin Mother to Her Child.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:3
verses.text: )  I shall not be jealous, my Son, that Thou art with me, and also with all men.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:4
verses.text: Be Thou God to him that confesses Thee, and be thou Lord to him that serves Thee, and be Brother to him that loves Thee, that Thou mayest gain all!  When Thou didst dwell in me, Thou didst also dwell out of me, and when I brought Thee forth openly, Thy hidden might was not removed from me.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:5
verses.text: Thou art within me, and Thou art without me, O Thou that makest Thy Mother amazed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:6
verses.text: For [when] I see that outward form of Thine before mine eyes, the hidden Form is shadowed forth "in my mind," O holy One.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:7
verses.text: In Thy visible form I see Adam, and in Thy hidden form I see Thy Father, who is joined with Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:8
verses.text: Hast Thou then shown me alone Thy Beauty in two Forms? Let Bread shadow forth Thee, and also the mind; dwell also in Bread and in the eaters thereof.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:9
verses.text: In secret, and openly too, may Thy Church see Thee, as well as Thy Mother.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:10
verses.text: He that hates Thy Bread is like unto him that hates Thy Body.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:11
verses.text: He that is far off that desires Thy Bread, and he that is near that loves Thy Image, are alike.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:12
verses.text: In the Bread and in the Body, the first and also the last have seen Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:13
verses.text: Yet Thy visible Bread is far more precious than Thy Body; for Thy Body even unbelievers have seen, but they have not seen Thy living Bread.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:14
verses.text: They that were far off rejoiced! their portion utterly scorns that of those that are near.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:15
verses.text: Lo! Thy Image is shadowed forth in the blood of the grapes on the Bread; and it is shadowed forth on the heart with the finger of love, with the colors of faith.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:16
verses.text: Blessed be He that by the Image of His Truth caused the graven images to pass away.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:17
verses.text: Thou art not [so] the Son of Man that I should sing unto Thee a common lullaby; for Thy Conception is new, and Thy Birth marvellous.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:18
verses.text: Without the Spirit who shall sing to Thee? A new muttering of prophecy is hot within me.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:19
verses.text: How shall I call Thee a stranger to us, Who art from us? Should I call Thee Son? Should I call Thee Brother? Husband should I call Thee? Lord should I call Thee, O Child that didst give Thy Mother a second birth from the waters?  For I am Thy sister, of the house of David the father of us Both.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:20
verses.text: Again, I am Thy Mother because of Thy Conception, and Thy Bride am I because of Thy sanctification, Thy handmaid and Thy daughter, from the Blood and Water wherewith Thou hast purchased me and baptised me.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:21
verses.text: The Son of the Most High came and dwelt in me, and I became His Mother; and as by a second birth I brought Him forth so did He bring me forth by the second birth, because He put His Mother's garments on, she clothed her body with His glory.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:22
verses.text: Tamar, who was of the house of David, Amnon put to shame; and virginity fell and perished from them both.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:23
verses.text: My pearl is not lost: in Thy treasury it is stored, because Thou hast put it on.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:24
verses.text: The scent of her brother-in-law slunk from Tamar, whose perfume she had stolen.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:25
verses.text: As for Joseph's Bride, not even his breath exhaled from her garments, since she conceived Cinnamon.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:26
verses.text: A wall of fire was Thy Conception unto me, O holy Son.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:27
verses.text: The little flower was faint, because the smell of the Lily of Glory was great.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:28
verses.text: The Treasure-house of spices stood in no need of flower or its smells! Flesh stood aloof because it perceived in the womb a Conception from the Spirit.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:29
verses.text: The woman ministers before the man, because he is her head.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:30
verses.text: Joseph rose to minister before his Lord, Who was in Mary.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:31
verses.text: The priest ministered before Thy ark by reason of Thy holiness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:32
verses.text: Moses carried the tables of stone which the Lord wrote, and Joseph bare about the pure Tablet in whom the Son of the Creator was dwelling.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 11:33
verses.text: The tables had ceased, because the world was filled with Thy doctrine.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:1
verses.text: Hymn XII.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:2
verses.text: The Babe that I carry carries me, saith Mary, and He has lowered His wings, and taken and placed me between His pinions, and mounted into the air; and a promise has been given me that height and depth shall be my Son's.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:3
verses.text: I have seen Gabriel that called him Lord, and the high priest the aged servant, that carried Him and bare Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:4
verses.text: I have seen the Magi when they bowed down, and Herod when he was troubled because the King had come.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:5
verses.text: Satan also who strangled the little ones that Moses might perish, murdered the little ones that the Living One might die.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:6
verses.text: To Egypt He fled, Who came to Judea that He might labour and wander there: he sought to catch the man that would catch himself.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:7
verses.text: In her virginity Eve put on the leaves of shame: Thy Mother put on in her Virginity the garment of Glory that suffices for all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:8
verses.text: She gave the little vest of the Body to Him that covers all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:9
verses.text: Blessed is she in whose heart and mind Thou wast! A King's palace she was by Thee, O Son of the King, and a Holy of Holies by Thee, O High Priest! She had not the trouble nor vexation of a family, or a husband!  Eve, again, was a nest and a den for the accursed serpent, that entered in and dwelt in her.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:10
verses.text: His evil counsel became bread to her that she might become dust.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:11
verses.text: Thou art our Bread, and Thou art also [of] our race and our garment of glory.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:12
verses.text: He that has sanctity, if he be in danger, lo! here is his Guardian! He that has iniquity, lo! here is his Pardoner! He that has a devil, here is the Pursuer thereof! They that have pains, lo! here is the Binder up of their breaches.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:13
verses.text: He that has a child, let him come and become a brother to my Well-beloved! He that has a daughter or a young woman of his race, let her come and become the bride of my Glorious One! He that has a servant, let him set him free, that he may come and serve his Lord.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:14
verses.text: The son of free men that bears Thy yoke, my Son, shall have one reward; and the slave that bears the burden of the yoke of two masters, of Him above and of Him below, there are two blessings for him, and two rewards of the two burdens.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:15
verses.text: The free woman, my Son, is Thy handmaid: also if she who is in bondage serve Thee, in Thee she is free: in Thee she shall be comforted, because she is freed; hidden apples in her bosom are stored up, if she love Thee!  O chaste woman, long ye for my Well-beloved, that He may dwell in you; and ye also that are impure that He may sanctify you! ye Churches also, that the Son of the Creator Who came to renew all creatures, may adorn you!  He received the foolish who worshipped and served all the stars; He renewed the earth which was worn out through Adam, who sinned and waxed old.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:16
verses.text: The new formation was the creature of its Renewer, and the all-sufficient One repaired the bodies along with their wills.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:17
verses.text: Come ye blind, and without money receive lights! Come ye lame, and receive your feet! ye deaf and dumb, receive your voice! come thou also whose hand is cut off; the maimed also shall receive his hands.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:18
verses.text: It is the Son of the Creator Whose treasure-houses are filled with all manner of helps.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:19
verses.text: Let him that is without eyeballs come to Him that makes clay and changes it, that makes flesh, that enlightens eyes.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:20
verses.text: By the small portion of clay He shows that it was with His hand that Adam was formed: the soul of the dead also bears Him witness, that by Him it was that the breath of man was breathed in; by the last witnesses He was accredited to be the Son of Him Who is the First.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:21
verses.text: Gather ye together and come, O ye lepers, and receive purification without labour.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:22
verses.text: For He will not wash you as Elisha, who baptized seven times in the river: neither will He trouble you as the priests did with their sprinklings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:23
verses.text: Foreigners and also strangers have betaken themselves to the Great Physician.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:24
verses.text: The rank of strangers hath no place with the King's Son; the Lord makes not Himself strange to His servants, [or conceal] that He is Lord of all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:25
verses.text: For if the Just makes the body leprous, and Thou purifiest it; then, the Former of the body hateth the body; but Thou lovest it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:26
verses.text: And if it be not Thy forming, being Just, Thou wouldest not have healed it; and if it were not Thy creature, when in health, Thou wouldest not have afflicted it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 12:27
verses.text: The punishments that Thou has cast upon it, and the pains which Thou hast healed, proclaim that Thou art the Creator's Son.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:1
verses.text: Hymn XIII.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:2
verses.text: (Compare Hymn II.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:3
verses.text: For the Epiphany.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:5
verses.text: In the days of the King whom they called by the name of Semha, our Lord sprang up among the Hebrews: and Semha and Denha ruled, and came, King upon earth, and Son in Heaven; blessed be His rule!  2.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:6
verses.text: In the days of the king who enrolled men in the book of the dead, our Redeemer came down and enrolled men in the book of the living.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:7
verses.text: He enrolled, and they also: on high He enrolled us, on earth they enrolled Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:8
verses.text: Glory to His Name!  3.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:9
verses.text: In the days of the king whose name was Semha, the type and the Reality met together, the king and the King, Semha and Denha.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:10
verses.text: His Cross upon His shoulders, was the sign of His Kingdom.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:11
verses.text: Blessed be He Who bare it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:13
verses.text: Thirty years He went in poverty upon the earth! The sounds of praise in all their measures let us twine, my brethren, to the years of the Lord, as thirty crowns to the thirty years.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:14
verses.text: Blessed be His Birth!  5.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:15
verses.text: In the first year, that is chieftain over the treasures and Dispenser of abundant blessings, let the Cherubim who bare up the Son in glory, praise Him with us! He left His glory, and toiled and found the sheep that was lost.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:16
verses.text: To Him be thanksgiving!  6.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:17
verses.text: In the second year, let the Seraphim praise Him yet more with us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:18
verses.text: They that had proclaimed the Son Holy, by and by saw Him when He was reviled among the gainsayers; He bore the contempt and taught praise.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:19
verses.text: To Him be Glory!  7.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:20
verses.text: In the third year, let Michael and his followers, that ministered to the Son in the highest, praise Him with us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:21
verses.text: They saw Him on the earth when He was ministering, washing feet, cleansing souls.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:22
verses.text: Blessed be His lowliness!  8.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:23
verses.text: In the fourth year, let the whole earth praise Him with us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:24
verses.text: It is but small for the Son, and it marvelled because it saw that it entertained Him in its bed that is so very mean.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:25
verses.text: He filled the bed, and filled the Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:26
verses.text: To Him be Majesty!  9.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:27
verses.text: In the fifth year, the Sun shone unto the earth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:28
verses.text: With its breath let it praise our Sun Who brought His breadth down low, and humbled His mightiness, that the subtle eye of the unseen soul might be able to look upon Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:29
verses.text: Blessed be His brightness!  10.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:30
verses.text: In the sixth year again, let the whole air praise Him with us, in whose wide space it is that all things are made glorious, which saw its mighty Lord that had become a little Child in a little bosom.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:31
verses.text: Blessed be His dignity!  11.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:32
verses.text: In the seventh year, the clouds and winds rejoiced with us and sprinkled the dews over the flowers, for they saw the Son who enslaved His brightness and received disgrace and foul spitting.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:33
verses.text: Blessed be His Redemption!  12.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:34
verses.text: In the year also that is eighth, let the fields give praise, that suckle their fruits from His fountains.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:35
verses.text: They worshipped because they saw the Son in arms and the pure One sucking pure milk.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:36
verses.text: Blessed be His good pleasure!  13.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:37
verses.text: In the ninth year, let the earth glorify the might of her Creator, Who laid seed in her in the beginning that she might bring forth all her produce; for it saw Mary, a thirsty land, who yielded the fruit of a Child that was a wonder, yea, a marvel.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:38
verses.text: [Then] it praised Him more exceedingly, for that He was a great Sea of all good things.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:39
verses.text: To Him be exaltation!  14.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:40
verses.text: In the tenth year, let the mount Sinai glorify Him, it which trembled before its Lord.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:41
verses.text: It saw that they took up stones against its Lord; He received stones, Who should build His Church upon a Stone.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:42
verses.text: Blessed be His building!  15.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:43
verses.text: In the eleventh year, let the great sea praise the fists of the Son that measured it, and it was astonished and saw that He came down, was baptized in a small water, and cleansed the creatures.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:44
verses.text: Blessed be His noble act!  16.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:45
verses.text: In the twelfth year, let the holy Temple praise Him, that saw the Child when He sat amongst the old men: the priests were silent when the Lamb of the Feast bleated in His feast.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:46
verses.text: Blessed be His propitiation!  17.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:47
verses.text: In the thirteenth year, let the crowns praise with us the King who conquered, that died and was crowned with a crown of thorns, and bound upon Adam a great crown at His right hand.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:48
verses.text: Blessed be His Apostleship!  18.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:49
verses.text: In the fourteenth year, let the passover in Egypt praise the Passover that came and passed over all, and instead of Pharaoh sunk Legion, instead of horses choked the devil.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:50
verses.text: Blessed be His vengeance!  19.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:51
verses.text: In the fifteenth year, let the lamb of the gluttons praise Him: since our Lord was so far from slaughtering it as Moses did, that He even redeemed mankind with His own Blood.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:52
verses.text: He that feeds all, died for all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:53
verses.text: Blessed be His Father!  20.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:54
verses.text: In the sixteenth year, let the wheat praise by its type that Husbandman, Who sowed His Body in the barren earth, since it covers all, spreads itself out and yields new Bread.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:55
verses.text: Blessed be the Pure One!  21.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:56
verses.text: In the seventeenth year, let the Vine praise the Lord that garnished it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:57
verses.text: He planted a vineyard, souls were as vineplants.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:58
verses.text: He gave peace to the vineyard, but destroyed the vineyard that brought forth wild grapes.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:59
verses.text: Blessed be its Uprooter!  22.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:60
verses.text: In the eighteenth year, let the Vine which the wild boar out of the wood had eaten, praise the True Vine which trimmed Himself, and kept His fruit, and brought the fruits to the Lord of the Vineyard.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:61
verses.text: Blessed be His Vintage!  23.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:62
verses.text: In the nineteenth year, let our leaven praise the true leaven which worked itself in among those that were in error, and drove them all together, and made them one mind by one Doctrine.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:63
verses.text: Blessed be thy doctrine!  24.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:64
verses.text: In the twentieth year, let salt praise Thy living Body, wherewith are salted the bodies and the souls of all the faithful, and faith is the salt of men wherewith they are preserved.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:65
verses.text: Blessed be Thy preserving!  25.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:66
verses.text: In the twenty-first year, let the waters of the desert praise Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:67
verses.text: They are sweet to them afar off, they are bitter to them that are near, who did not minister to Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:68
verses.text: The [chosen] people and the nations were bitter in the desert, and He destroyed them.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:69
verses.text: They were sweetened by the Cross which redeemed them.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:70
verses.text: Blessed be Thy pleasantness!  26.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:71
verses.text: In the twenty-second year, let arms and the sword praise Thee: they sufficed not to kill our adversary.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:72
verses.text: It was Thou that killed him, even Thou who didst fix the ear on, which Simon's sword cut off.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:73
verses.text: Blessed be Thy healing!  27.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:74
verses.text: In the twenty-third year, let the ass praise Him, that gave its foal for Him to ride on, that loosed the bonds, that opened the mouth of the dumb, that opened also the mouth of the wild asses when the race of Hagar gave a shout of praise.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:75
verses.text: Blessed be the praise of Thee!  28.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:76
verses.text: In the twenty-fourth year, let the Treasury praise the Son.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:77
verses.text: The treasures marvelled at the Lord of treasures, when in the house of the poor He was increasing, Who made Himself poor that He might enrich all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:78
verses.text: Blessed be Thy rule!  29.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:79
verses.text: In the twenty-fifth year, let Isaac praise the Son, for by His goodness he was rescued upon the Mount from the knife, and in his stead there was the victim, the type of the Lamb for the slaughter.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:80
verses.text: The mortal escaped, and He that quickens all died.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:81
verses.text: Blessed be His offering!  30.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:82
verses.text: In the twenty-sixth year, let Moses praise Him with us, for that he was afraid and fled from his murderers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:83
verses.text: Let him praise the Lord that bore the spear and that received the nails in His hands, in His feet.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:84
verses.text: He entered into hell and spoiled it, and came forth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:85
verses.text: Blessed be Thy Resurrection!  31.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:86
verses.text: In the year which is the twenty-seventh, let the eloquent speakers praise the Son, for they found no cloke to save our cause.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:87
verses.text: He was silent in the judgment-hall, and He carried our cause.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:88
verses.text: Honour be to Him!  32.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:89
verses.text: And in this year let all judges praise Him, who, as being just men, killed the ungodly; let them praise the Son who died for the wicked, as being good.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:90
verses.text: Though Son of the Just One, He gave them all manner of good things in abundance.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:91
verses.text: Blessed be His bowels of mercy!  33.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:92
verses.text: In the eight and twentieth year, let all mighty men of valour praise the Son, because they delivered not from him who took us captive.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:93
verses.text: He only is to be praised, who being slain showed us life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:94
verses.text: Blessed be His delivery!  34.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:95
verses.text: In the twenty-ninth year, let Job praise Him with us, who bore sufferings for himself, and our Lord bore for us the spitting and the spear, and the crown of thorns, and scourges, contempt and reproach, yea mocking.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:96
verses.text: Blessed be His mercy!  35.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:97
verses.text: In the year that is thirteenth, let the dead praise Him with us, because they are quickened, and the living, because they have turned to repentance, because height and depth were set at one by Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 13:98
verses.text: Blessed be He and His Father!.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:1
verses.text: Hymn XIV.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:3
verses.text: —Blessed be he who became beyond measure low, that he might make us beyond measure great)  1.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:4
verses.text: Of the Birth of the Firstborn, let us tell on His Feast-day.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:5
verses.text: —He gives on His day, secret comforts.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:6
verses.text: —If the unclean King at his feast, in memory of his day,—gave the gift of wrath, the head in a charger,—how much more shall the Blessed, give blessings to him—who sings praise at His Feast!  2.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:7
verses.text: Let us not count our vigil like vigils of every day.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:8
verses.text: —His feast, its reward, exceeds an hundredfold.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:9
verses.text: —For this feast makes war, on sleep by its vigil;—speaking it makes war, on silence by its voice;—clad with all blessings, it is chief of feasts,—and of every joy.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:11
verses.text: To-day the angels, and the archangels,—descended to sing—a new song on earth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:12
verses.text: —In this mystery they descend, and rejoice with the vigil-keepers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:13
verses.text: —At the time when they gave praise, blasphemy abounded.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:14
verses.text: —Blessed be the Birth by which, lo! the world resounds—with anthems of praise.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:16
verses.text: For this is the night that joined, the Watchers on high with the vigil-keepers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:17
verses.text: —The Watcher came to make watchers in the midst of creation.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:18
verses.text: —Lo! the vigil-keepers are made comrades with the Watchers:—the singers of praise are made, companions of the Seraphs.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:19
verses.text: —Blessed be he who becomes, the harp of Thy praise!—and Thy grace becomes his reward.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:21
verses.text: The Birth then of the Firstborn, I will sing and tell how—the Godhead in the womb wove itself a vesture.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:22
verses.text: —He put it on and came forth in birth, in death again put it off;—once he put it off, twice He put it on.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:23
verses.text: —On the left He wore it, then took it off thence,—and laid it at the right.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:25
verses.text: He dwelt in a narrow bosom, the Might that rules all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:26
verses.text: —While He was dwelling there, He held the reins of the whole:—to His Father He made offering, that He might fulfil His Will:—Heaven was filled by Him, and every creature.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:27
verses.text: —The Sun entered the womb, and in the height and the depth—his splendour abode.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:29
verses.text: He dwelt in the wide bosoms, of all the creatures;—too narrow to hold, the greatness of the Firstborn.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:30
verses.text: —How then sufficed for it, that bosom of Mary?—Marvellous if it sufficed, bewilderment if it sufficed not.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:31
verses.text: —Of all bosoms that held Him, one bosom sufficed for Him,—His, the Supreme Who begat Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:33
verses.text: The bosom that held Him, if it held Him Wholly,—equals the wondrous bosom, of the Supreme Who begat Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:34
verses.text: —But who dare say the bosom, that is narrow weak and lowly,—is equal to His, Who is the Supreme Being?—He dwelt there of His mercy, though so great is His Nature:—it is without bound.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:36
verses.text: Reconciling Peace, sent to the nations!—gladdening Brightness, that camest to the sad!—Mighty Leaven in silence, overcoming all!—Patient One that hast taken, man after man in Thy net!—Happy he who has welcomed, thy joy in his heart,—and forgot his groans in Thee!  10.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:37
verses.text: They sounded forth peace, the Watchers to the vigil-keepers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:38
verses.text: —Among the vigil-keepers the good tidings, were announced by the Watchers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:39
verses.text: —Who would sleep on that night, which has waked all creatures?—For they bear good tidings of peace, where warfare had been.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:40
verses.text: —Blessed is he who has pleased, the Divine Majesty by his silence,—when speaking moved His wrath!  11.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:41
verses.text: Watchers mixed with watchers, they rejoiced that the world came to life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:42
verses.text: —The Evil One was shamed who was king, and had woven a crown of lies;—and set up his throne, as God in the world.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:43
verses.text: —The Babe laid in the manger, cast him from his dominion.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:44
verses.text: —The Sun rendered worship, doing Him homage by his Magi;—in his worshippers he worshipped Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:46
verses.text: God saw that mankind, worship things created:—He put on a created body, that in our custom He might capture us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:47
verses.text: —Lo! in this our form, He that formed us healed us;—and in this created shape, our Creator gave us life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:48
verses.text: —He drew us not by force: blessed be He Who came in ours,—and joined us in His!  13.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:49
verses.text: Who would not marvel, at Mary, David's daughter,—bearing an infant, and her virginity kept!—She lays Him on her breast, and lulls Him with song and He rejoices.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:50
verses.text: —The Angels raise hymns, the Seraphs cry "Holy,"—the Magi offer, acceptable gifts,—to the Son Who is born.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:52
verses.text: O great above measure, immeasurably made low,—praised beyond praises, debased to humiliation!—the tender mercies laid on Thee, bowed Thee down to all this;—let Thy grace bow me down, though evil to give praise!—Happy he who becomes, a fountain of voices,—all praising Thee in all!  15.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:53
verses.text: He was servant on earth; He is Lord in Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:54
verses.text: —Heir of height and depth, He became a stranger:—Whom men judged in guile, He is judge in truth:—He Whose face they spat on, breathes His Spirit on theirs:—He Who held the frail reed, is become the staff of the world,—which grows old and leans on Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:56
verses.text: He Who rose to wait on His servants, now sits to be worshipped.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:57
verses.text: —Whom the scribes despised, before Him Seraphs cry "Holy".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:58
verses.text: —This praise Adam desired, to steal privily.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:59
verses.text: —The serpent which made him fall, saw to what height he was raised:—he crushed it because it deceived him; the feet of Eve trod it down,—which had sent venom into her ears.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:61
verses.text: The wife proved barren, and withheld her fruit;—but the bosom of Mary, holily conceived.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:62
verses.text: —To wonder at fields, and to admire plants—she needed not who received, and rendered what she borrowed not.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:63
verses.text: —Nature confessed its defeat; the womb was aware of it,—and restored what Nature gave not.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:65
verses.text: Mary was defeated, in the judgment by Elizabeth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:66
verses.text: —She that was barren pleaded, that the Will which prevailed—to close the open door, has opened the closed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:67
verses.text: —He has made childless the married womb; He has made fruitful the virgin womb.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:68
verses.text: —Because the People were accurst faithless, He made her that was married,—held from bearing before the face of the maiden.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:70
verses.text: He Who could give moisture, to breasts barren and dead,—caused them to fail in youth, made them to flow in age;—forced and changed nature, in its season and out of its season.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:71
verses.text: —The Lord of natures changed, the Virgin's nature.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:72
verses.text: —Because the People were barren, He made her that was aged,—a mouth on behalf of the damsel.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:74
verses.text: And as He began at birth, He went on and fulfilled in death.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:75
verses.text: —His Birth received worship; His Death paid the debt.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:76
verses.text: —As He came to His Birth, the Magi worshipped Him;—again He came to His Passion, and the thief sought refuge in Him—Between His Birth and Death, midway He set the world:—in birth and Death he gave it life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:78
verses.text: Thousand thousands stand, and ten thousand thousands haste.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:79
verses.text: —The thousands and ten thousands, cannot search out the One:—for all of them stand, in silence to serve.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:80
verses.text: —He has no heir of His Throne, save the Son Who is of Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:81
verses.text: —In the midst of silence is the enquiry into Him, when the watchers come to search Him out,—they attain to silence and are stayed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:83
verses.text: The Firstborn entered the womb, and the pure Virgin was not harmed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:84
verses.text: —He stirred and came forth in her travail, and the fair Mother was troubled by Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:85
verses.text: —Glorious and unseen in entering, humble and manifest in issuing;—for He was God in entering, and He was man in issuing.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:86
verses.text: —A marvel and bewilderment to hear: fire entered the womb; put on a body and came forth!  23.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:87
verses.text: Gabriel chief of Angels, called Him "My Lord":—he called Him "My Lord," to teach that He was his Lord, not his fellow.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:88
verses.text: —Gabriel had with him, Michael as fellow:—the Son is Lord of the servants; exalted is His Nature as His Name.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:89
verses.text: —No servant can search Him out; for the greater the servant,—He is great above His servant.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:91
verses.text: When they stand before Thee, the watchers with songs of praise,—they know not in what part, they shall discern Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:92
verses.text: —They have sought Thee above in the height; they have seen Thee below in the depth:—they have searched for Thee in the midst of heaven; they have seen Thee in the midst of the abyss:—they have discerned Thee beside Him that is worshipped; they have found Thee in the midst of the creatures:—they have come down to Thee and sung Glory to Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:94
verses.text: Thou art all wonderful, in all parts where we seek Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:95
verses.text: —Near art Thou,—and far, and who may attain to Thee?—No seeking avails, that its stretch should reach unto Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:96
verses.text: —Whereon it stretches to reach Thee, it is checked and stops,—it falls short of Thy mountain; Faith reaches thither,—and Love with prayer.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:98
verses.text: The Magi also sought Him, and in the manger when they found Him,—instead of scrutiny worship, they offered Him in silence;—for empty strivings, oblations gave they Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 14:99
verses.text: —Seek thou too the Firstborn, and if thou find Him in the height,—instead of troubled questionings, open thy treasures before Him,—and offer Him thy works.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:1
verses.text: Hymn XV.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:2
verses.text: Resp.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:3
verses.text: —Blessed is He above all in His Birth! (bis).

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:5
verses.text: Celebrate, O nations, this feast, first fruits of all feasts;—recount the sufferings that were, and the wounds and pains,—that we may know what plagues, He healed, the Son Who was sent.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:6
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:7
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who sufficed to heal our pains!  2.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:8
verses.text: Celebrate, O saved nations, Him Who saves all in His Birth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:9
verses.text: —Even my feeble tongue, has become a harp through His mercy.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:10
verses.text: —The excellency of the Firstborn, in His Festival let us sing.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:11
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:12
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who has made us meet for His Feast!  3.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:13
verses.text: How then can any one, admire a physician,—until he hear and learn, what were the pains he healed?—And when our plagues are proclaimed, then is our Healer magnified.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:14
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:15
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who is exalted in our pains!  4.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:16
verses.text: Created things were worshipped: because the worshipper was foolish,—he used to worship all things; but One they worshipped not.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:17
verses.text: —He came down therefore in mercy and broke, the yoke that enslaved all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:18
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:19
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who loosed our pains!  5.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:20
verses.text: The mercies of the Highest were revealed; He came down and set free His creature.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:21
verses.text: —In this blessed month, wherein are made releases of slaves,—the Lord underwent bondage, to call the bond to freedom.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:22
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:23
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who brought freedom!  6.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:24
verses.text: The Lord of the months chose Him, two months for His doings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:25
verses.text: —His Conception was in Nisan, and His Birth in Conun.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:26
verses.text: —In Nisan He sanctified them that were conceived; and them that were born He set free in Conun.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:27
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:28
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who makes glad His months!  7.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:29
verses.text: The Sun revealed in silence, his worshippers to his Lord:—it was grievous to him, a servant, to be worshipped instead of his Lord.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:30
verses.text: —Lo! creation is glad, that the Creator is worshipped.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:31
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:32
verses.text: , Blessed is the Child that is worshipped.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:34
verses.text: The months wore three crowns, and crowned Him in His triumphs.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:35
verses.text: —Blessed is the Sun for His Birth, and for His Resurrection desired,—and for His Ascension blessed; the months have borne Him crowns.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:36
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:37
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has triumphed in His months!  9.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:38
verses.text: Unveil and make glad thy face, O Creature, in our feast.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:39
verses.text: —Let the Church sing with voice; Heaven and earth in silence!—Sing and praise the Child, who has brought release for all!  R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:40
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has annulled the bonds!  10.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:41
verses.text: When fools did reverence to the Sun, in reverence to him they disgraced him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:42
verses.text: —But now when all know he is a servant, in his course his Lord is worshipped;—all servants rejoice, that as servants they are reckoned.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:43
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:44
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who ordered their natures!  11.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:45
verses.text: We have done perverse things, who have become servants of servants.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:46
verses.text: —Lo! our freedom compelled him, a servant, to become lord to us:—the Sun, the servant for all, we have made Lord for all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:47
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:48
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who to Himself has turned us!  12.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:49
verses.text: And the Moon too which was worshipped, has been set free by His Birth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:50
verses.text: —For 'tis strange that by her light, which enlightens the eyes,—by it the eyes were darkened, that they gazed on her as a God.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:51
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:52
verses.text: , Blessed be the beam that has enlightened us!  13.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:53
verses.text: Fire commended Thy Birth, which drew away worship from it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:54
verses.text: —The magi used to worship it: they who have worshipped before Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:55
verses.text: —They left it and worshipped its Lord; they exchanged fire for the Fire.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:56
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:57
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who has bathed us in His light!  14.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:58
verses.text: In place of the senseless fire that eats up its own body of itself,—the magi adored the Fire Who gave His Body to be eaten.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:59
verses.text: —The live coal drew near and sanctified, the lips that were unclean.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:60
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:61
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who has mixed His Fire in us!  15.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:62
verses.text: Delusion blinded men, to worship created things:—fellow servants were worshipped, and the God of all was wronged.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:63
verses.text: —He Who is to be worshipped came down to His birth, and gathered to himself worship.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:64
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:65
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who by all is worshipped!  16.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:66
verses.text: The All-knowing saw, that men worship things that were made:—He put on a body that was made, that in our custom He might take us captive,—and by a body that was made, drew us to the Creator.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:67
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:68
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who drew us with guile!  17.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:69
verses.text: The Evil One knew how to harm us; and by lights he blinded us,—by possessions he hurt us, through gold he made us poor,—by the graver's graven images, he made us a heart of stone.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:70
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:71
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who came and softened it!  18.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:72
verses.text: They graved and set up stones, whereon men should stumble.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:73
verses.text: —They set them not on the highway, for the blind to stumble on:—they called them Gods, that on them with open eyes men might stumble.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:74
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:75
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who exposed the idols which they feared!  19.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:76
verses.text: Sin had spread its wings, and covered all things,—that none could discern, of himself or from above, the truth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:77
verses.text: —Truth came down into the womb, came forth and rolled away error.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:78
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:79
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who dispelled Sin by His Birth!  20.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:80
verses.text: For Mercy endured not, to see the way hindered.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:81
verses.text: —When He came down for conception, He opened the way and made it easy:—when He came forth in birth, He trod it and marked its miles.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:82
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:83
verses.text: , Blessed is the peace of Thy Way!  21.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:84
verses.text: He chose the Prophets; they cleared the way for the people:—He sent the Apostles; they smoothed paths for the nations.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:85
verses.text: —The snares of the Evil One were shamed, when feeble men cleared them away.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:86
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:87
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who made our paths plain!  22.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:88
verses.text: The graven images blinded, their gravers in secret:—they graved eyes on stone, and darkened the eyes of the soul.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:89
verses.text: —Praise to Thy Birth that opened, the sight that was blinded.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:90
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:91
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has restored sight!  23.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:92
verses.text: Let women praise Her, the pure Mary,—that as in Eve their mother,—great was their reproach,—lo! in Mary their sister,—greatly magnified was their honour.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:93
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:94
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who sprang from women!  24.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:95
verses.text: Let the nations praise Thy Birth, that they have gained eyes to see,—how their wine has made them reel; and they have seen their own humiliation?—They come to know themselves, and worship Him who has rescued them.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:96
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:97
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who has taught repentance!  25.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:98
verses.text: Its worship mankind—had spread everywhere:—Him Who is to be worshipped it sought not, that worship should be paid Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:99
verses.text: —But He endured not—worshippers that err.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:100
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:101
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who came down and is worshipped!  26.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:102
verses.text: The gold of the idols worshipped Thee, that Thou didst treat it as alms; which availed not apart, for the uses of life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:103
verses.text: —It hasted to Thy purse, as it had hasted to the manger.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:104
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:105
verses.text: , Blessed be He Whom Creation has loved!  27.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:106
verses.text: The frankincense worshipped Thy Birth, which had served demons.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:107
verses.text: —It sorrowed then in its vapour: it exulted when it saw its Lord.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:108
verses.text: —Instead of being the incense of delusion, it was an oblation before God!  R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:109
verses.text: , Blessed is Thy Birth which is worshipped!  28.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:110
verses.text: The myrrh worshipped Thee for itself, and for its kindred ointments.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:111
verses.text: —The hands that bore its ointment, had anointed abominable graven images.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:112
verses.text: —To Thee the perfume was sweet, from the anointing wherewith Mary anointed Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:113
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:114
verses.text: , Blessed is Thy savour which is sweet to us!  29.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:115
verses.text: The gold that had been worshipped worshipped thee, when the magi offered it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:116
verses.text: —That which had been worshipped in molten images, gave worship to Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:117
verses.text: —With its worshippers it worshipped Thee, it confessed that Thou art He that is to be worshipped.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:118
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:119
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who claimed worship for Himself!  30.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:120
verses.text: The Evil One fled and his hosts, he that used to exult in the world.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:121
verses.text: —In the high places they sacrificed heifers to him, in the gardens they slew bulls for him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:122
verses.text: —He swallowed up all creation, he filled his belly with prey.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:123
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:124
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who came and made him disgorge!  31.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:125
verses.text: Of him the Lord said, that he had fallen from Heaven.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:126
verses.text: —The Abhorred One had exalted himself; from his uplifting he has fallen.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:127
verses.text: The foot of Mary has trod him down, who bruised Eve with his heel.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:128
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:129
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who by His Birth laid him low!  32.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:130
verses.text: Chaldeans went about, in all places and led astray:—the preachers of delusion, were shamed through the world,—they were shamed and overcome,—by the preachers of truth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:131
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:132
verses.text: , Blessed be the Babe Whom they preached!  33.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:133
verses.text: Sin had spread out, her nets for the draught.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:134
verses.text: —Praise be to Thy Birth that captured, the nets of delusion.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:135
verses.text: —The soul took flight on high, which had been taken in the deep.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:136
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:137
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who prepared for us wings!  34.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:138
verses.text: His Will was able, even by force to rescue us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:139
verses.text: —But since it was not force that made us guilty, it was not by force He purged us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:140
verses.text: —The Evil One by enticement enslaved us: Thy Birth enticed to give us life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:141
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:142
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who planned and gave us life!  35.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:143
verses.text: The creatures complained that they were worshipped; in silence they sought release.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:144
verses.text: —The All-Releaser heard, and because He endured it not He came down,—put on the form of a servant in the womb, came forth, set free Creation.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:145
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:146
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who made his Creation his gain!  36.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:147
verses.text: Mercy was kindled on high, at the voice of Creation that cried out:—Gabriel was sent; he came and gave tidings of Thy Conception.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:148
verses.text: —When Thou camest to the Birth, Watchers gave tidings of thy coming forth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:149
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:150
verses.text: , Blessed be by Thy Worship above all!  37.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:151
verses.text: For greater is the joy of the Birth than the Conception.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:152
verses.text: —Yea it was one angel, that brought us tidings of Thy Conception:—but in the joy of Thy Birth, a multitude of Watchers brought tidings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:153
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:154
verses.text: , Blessed be Thy tidings in Thy day!  38.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:155
verses.text: Glory to Thee I too in Thy day, will offer, O Thou that art worshipped!—Take of the fruit that is mine; and give me mercy which is Thine!—For if the evil that is in me gives gifts, how much more shalt Thou give Who art good!  R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:156
verses.text: , Blessed is Thy wealth in Thy servant!  39.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:157
verses.text: The two things Thou soughtest, in Thy Birth have been done for us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:158
verses.text: —Our visible body Thou hast put on; Thy invisible might we have put on:—our body has become Thy clothing; Thy Spirit has become our robe.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:159
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:160
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has been adorned and has adorned us!  40.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:161
verses.text: Height and depth were amazed, that Thy Birth subdued the rebels.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:162
verses.text: —For that we gave Thee hostages, Thou gavest us the Paraclete:—when the hostages went up from us, the Captain of the host came down to us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:163
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:164
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who took away and sent down!  41.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:165
verses.text: Come ye mouths of all and pour forth, and be in the likeness of waters, and wells of voices! May the Holy Spirit come,—and sing glory through us all, to the Father Who has redeemed us through His Son!  R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 15:166
verses.text: , Blessed is He above all in His Birth!.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:1
verses.text: Hymn XVI.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:3
verses.text: —Glory to all of Thee from all of us! (bis.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:5
verses.text: Who then that is mortal man, can declare concerning the All-Life giver,—Who quitted the height of His Majesty, and abased Himself to humility?—Thou Who exaltest all in Thy Birth, exalt my weak mind,—to declare of Thy Birth; not that I should search out Thy Majesty,—but that I should proclaim Thy grace.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:6
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:7
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who conceals and reveals in His discourses!  2.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:8
verses.text: It is a great marvel that the Son, dwelt wholly in a body;—abode therein wholly and it sufficed for Him; dwelt therein though not bounded thereby.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:9
verses.text: —His Will was wholly therein; His bounds reached wholly to His Father.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:10
verses.text: —Who is sufficient to tell, how though He dwelt wholly in a body.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:11
verses.text: —He likewise dwelt wholly in all?  R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:12
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who though without bounds was bounded!  3.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:13
verses.text: Thy Majesty is concealed from us; Thy Grace is revealed before us.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:14
verses.text: —I will be silent, O Lord of Thy Majesty; and I will tell of Thy grace.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:15
verses.text: —Thy grace clove to Thee, and bowed Thee down to our vileness:—Thy grace made Thee a babe; Thy grace made Thee man:—it straitened, it enlarged, Thy Majesty.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:16
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:17
verses.text: , Blessed be the might that became little and became great!  4.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:18
verses.text: Glory to Him Who became lowly, though lofty He was by His nature!—He became in His love the firstborn of Mary, Firstborn though He be of Godhead.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:19
verses.text: —He became in name the offspring of Joseph, offspring though He be of the Most High.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:20
verses.text: —He became by His own Will man, God though He be by His Nature.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:21
verses.text: —Glorified be Thy Will and Thy Nature!  R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:22
verses.text: , Blessed be Thy Glory which put on our image!  5.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:23
verses.text: Yea, O Lord, Thy Birth, has become mother of all creatures; for it travailed anew and gave birth, to mankind which gave birth to Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:24
verses.text: Thou wast born of it bodily; it was born of Thee spiritually.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:25
verses.text: —All that Thou camest for to birth, was that man might be born in Thy likeness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:26
verses.text: —Thy Birth became the author of birth to all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:27
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:28
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who became a youth and to all gave youth!  6.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:29
verses.text: When man's hope had broken down, hope was increased by Thy Birth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:30
verses.text: —Good tidings of hope they bore, the Heavenly Ones to men.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:31
verses.text: —Satan who cut off our hope, his own hope by his own hands had cut off.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:32
verses.text: —when he saw that hope was increased: Thy Birth became to the hopeless,—a fountain teaming with hope.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:33
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:34
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who bore the tidings of hope!  7.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:35
verses.text: The day of Thy Birth is like Thee, for it is desired and loved as Thou.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:36
