verses.text: —We who saw not Thy Birth, and its flame as in its own time,—in this Thy day we see Thee, even as Thou wast a babe;—beloved by all men, lo! in Thee the Churches rejoice;—Thy day adorns and is adorned.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:37
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:38
verses.text: , Blessed be Thy day which was ordained for us!  8.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:39
verses.text: Thy day has given us a gift, to which the Father has none other like;—It was not Seraphim He sent us, nor yet did Cherubim come down among us;—there came not Watchers or Ministers, but the Firstborn to Whom they minister.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:40
verses.text: —Who can suffice to give thanks, that the Majesty which is beyond measure—is laid in the lowly manger!  R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:41
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who gave us what He had won!  9.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:42
verses.text: That generation Thy Birth made glad, and our generation Thy day makes glad: twofold was the happiness of that generation, for they saw Thy Birth and also Thy day:—less is the happiness of them that come after, for the day of Thy Birth they see only.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:43
verses.text: —Yet because they that then were, doubted, greater is the happiness of them that come after,—who though they have not seen Thee have believed in Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:44
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:45
verses.text: , Blessed be Thy happiness that is added to us!  10.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:46
verses.text: The Magi exalted from afar; the Scribes murmured near at hand;—the prophet showed his message, and Herod his wrath;—the scribes showed their doctrine, the Magi showed their offerings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:47
verses.text: It is a marvel that to Him, the Babe, they of His own house hasted with their swords, and they that were strangers with their offerings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:48
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:49
verses.text: , Blessed be Thy Birth which has stirred up all!  11.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:50
verses.text: The bosom of Mary amazes me, that it sufficed for Thee, Lord, and embraced Thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:51
verses.text: —All creation were too small, to conceal Thy Majesty;—Heaven and earth too narrow, to be in the likeness of wings, to cover Thy Godhead.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:52
verses.text: —Too small for Thee was the bosom of earth; great enough for Thee was the bosom of Mary.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:53
verses.text: —He dwelt in the bosom and healed in her bosom.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:54
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:56
verses.text: He was wrapped meanly in swaddling clothes, and offerings were offered Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:57
verses.text: —He put on garments in youth, and from them there came forth helps: He put on the waters of baptism, and from them there shone forth beams:—He put on linen cloths in death, and in them were shown forth triumphs; with His humiliations, His exaltations.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:58
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:59
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who joined His Glory to His Passion!  13.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:60
verses.text: All these are the changes of raiment, which Mercy put off and put on,—when He strove to put on Adam, the glory which he had put off.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:61
verses.text: —He was wrapped in swaddling-clothes as Adam with leaves; and clad in garments instead of skins.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:62
verses.text: —He was baptized for Adam's sin, and buried for Adam's death:—He rose and raised Adam into Glory.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:63
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:64
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who came down and clothed him and went up!  14.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:65
verses.text: Though Thy Birth had sufficed, for Adam's sons as for Adam;—O Mighty One Who didst become a babe, in Thy Birth anew hast Thou begotten me!—O pure One Who wast baptized, let Thy Washing wash away our filth—O Living One who wast buried, may we gain life in Thy death!—I will praise all of Thee in Him that fills all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:66
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 16:67
verses.text: , Glory to all of Thee from all of us!.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:1
verses.text: Hymn XVII.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:3
verses.text: , Praise to Thee from every mouth on this Day of Thy Birth!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:4
verses.text: Infants were slain because of Thy Birth, Thou Giver of life to all—But because He Who was slain was a King, our Lord the Lord of Kingdoms,—the tyrant in subtlety, gave for Him slain hostages,—clad in the mysteries of His slaying: the ranks of heaven received,—the hostages that they of earth offered.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:5
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:6
verses.text: , Blessed be the King who magnified Him!  2.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:7
verses.text: All the Kings of the house of David, transmitted and hauled on each to each,—the throne and crown of the Son of David, as guardian of a deposit.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:8
verses.text: —In one they reached their bound and limit, when He came, the Lord of all things,—and took away from them all things, and cut off the transmission of all things.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:10
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who is clad in that which is His!  3.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:11
verses.text: The doves moaned in Bethlehem, that the serpent destroyed their offspring.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:12
verses.text: —The eagle betook himself to Egypt, to go down and receive the promises.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:13
verses.text: —Egypt rejoiced in Him that there came, abundance for payment of debts,—which had failed the sons of Joseph.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:14
verses.text: Among the sons of Joseph He laboured and paid—the debts of the sons of Joseph.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:15
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:16
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who called Him out of Egypt!  4.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:17
verses.text: The Scribes read daily, that the Star arises out of Jacob.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:18
verses.text: —For the People were the Voice and the reading, for the nations the rising of the Star and the interpretation:—for them were the Books and for us the facts; for them boughs and for us fruits.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:19
verses.text: —The Scribes read in things written; the Magi saw in things done, the outshining of that which was read.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:20
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:21
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who added to us their books!  5.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:22
verses.text: Who is able to tell, of the withdrawal and the appearings,—of the shining star that went, before the bearers of the offerings?—It appeared and proclaimed the crown; it was hid and concealed His Body.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:23
verses.text: —It was for the Son in twofold wise, herald and guardian;—it guarded His Body, it proclaimed His Crown.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:24
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:25
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who has given wisdom to them that proclaim Him!  6.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:26
verses.text: The tyrant gazed on the Magi, as they asked "Where is the son of the King?"—While his heart was gloomy, he sought for himself a cheerful countenance.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:27
verses.text: —With the sheep he sent wolves, that should kill the Lamb of God.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:28
verses.text: —The Lamb went down to Egypt, that thence He might judge them,—whence He had saved them.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:29
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:30
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who yet again subdued them.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:32
verses.text: The Magi declared to the tyrant, "When thy servants joined us,—the bright star withdrew itself, yea the paths hid themselves".

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:33
verses.text: —The blessed ones knew not, that the king had sent bitter foes,—murderers as if worshippers, to destroy the sweet fruit,—whereof the bitter eat and are made sweet.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:34
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:35
verses.text: , To Thee be glory, Medicine of life!  8.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:36
verses.text: When there the Magi received, commandment to go and seek Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:37
verses.text: —it is written of them that they saw, that bright star and rejoiced.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:38
verses.text: —Thus it is known that it had been withdrawn; therefore rejoiced they at its aspect.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:39
verses.text: —It was hid and hindered the murderers, it arose and called the worshippers;—it overthrew a part and it called a part.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:40
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:41
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has triumphed in both parts!  9.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:42
verses.text: The abhorred one who slew the children, how did he overlook the Child?—Justice hindered him that he thought, the Magi would return to him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:43
verses.text: —While he stayed waiting to seize, the Worshipped and His worshippers,—everything escaped his hands, the offerings and the worshippers took flight,—from the tyrant to the Son of the King.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:44
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:45
verses.text: , Glory to Him who knows all counsels!  10.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:46
verses.text: The blameless Magi as they slept, meditated on their beds:—sleep became a mirror, and a dream rose on it as light.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:47
verses.text: —The murderer they saw and trembled, as his guile and his sword flashed forth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:48
verses.text: —He taught the men guile, he sharpened the sword to sharpness:—the Watcher taught the sleepers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:49
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:50
verses.text: , Blessed is He who gives prudence to the simple!  11.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:51
verses.text: The simple who believe have known, two Comings of Christ:—but the foolish scribes have not even perceived one Coming.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:52
verses.text: —Yet the nations have life in the first, and shall rise again there in the second.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:53
verses.text: —The People whose mind is blinded, the first Coming has dispersed;—the second shall blot out their memory.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:54
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:55
verses.text: , Blessed be the King Who is come and is to come!  12.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:56
verses.text: When the Saviour arose as the blind, the Sun showed forth his beams,—and they were clothed in darkness: the Brightness sent forth his light,—and He brought the sons of the stars, to make manifest the sons of darkness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:57
verses.text: —For lo! among you is the star, but on your eyes the veil.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:58
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:59
verses.text: , To Thee be glory, newborn Sun!  13.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:60
verses.text: Prophets declared concerning His Birth, but they made not plain the time thereof.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:61
verses.text: —He sent the Magi, and they came and showed of its time.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:62
verses.text: —Yet the Magi who made known the time, made not plain who the Child should be.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:63
verses.text: —A star of splendid light, in its course showed who the Child was,—how splendid was His lineage.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:64
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:65
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who by them all was pointed out!  14.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:66
verses.text: They scorned the trumpet of Isaiah, which sounded forth His pure Conception,—they silenced the lute of the Psalms, which sang of His Priesthood;—the harp of the Spirit they hushed, which sang again of His Kingdom;—under deep silence they closed up, the great Birth that joined the cry—of them above with them below.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:67
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:68
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who appeared in the midst of silence!  15.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:69
verses.text: His voice was the secret key that opened the mouths of the Magi.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:70
verses.text: —Whereas preachers were silent in Judah, they made their voice sound through creation;—and the Gospel which those had scorned, these who came from far took and departed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:71
verses.text: —The scorners began to hear their own orders from strangers, who cried out the name of the Son of David.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:72
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:73
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who by our voice has put them to silence!  16.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:74
verses.text: Whereas the People scorned offerings, and brought them not to Him the Son of the King,—He sent His herald to the nations, and caused them to come with their offerings:—yet not all of them caused He to come, for it could not suffice for them,—the narrow bosom of Bethlehem; but the bosom of Holy Church,—enlarged itself and contained her children.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:75
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:76
verses.text: , Blessed be He Who has made the barren fruitful!  17.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:77
verses.text: The slayers of Bethlehem mowed down the tender flowers that among them—should perish the tender seedling, wherein was hidden the Bread of life.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:78
verses.text: —But the ear of corn that has life had escaped, that it should come to the sheaves in harvest:—the grape that escaped when young, gave itself to the treading,—that its wine might give life to souls.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:79
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:80
verses.text: , Glory to Thee, Treasury of life!  18.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:81
verses.text: The murderers went into a paradise, full of tender fruits:—they shook off the flowers from the bough, blossoms and buds they destroyed,—unblemished oblations he offered, the persecutor unwittingly.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:82
verses.text: —To him woe, but to them blessing! Bethlehem was first to give, virgin fruits to the Holy One.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:83
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:84
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who receives the first fruits!  19.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:85
verses.text: The Scribes were silenced in envy, the Pharisees in jealousy.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:86
verses.text: —Men of stone cried out and gave praise, who had a heart of stone.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:87
verses.text: —They applauded in presence of the Stone, the rejected that has become the Head.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:88
verses.text: —Stones were made flesh by that Stone, and obtained mouths to speak; stones cried out through that Stone.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:89
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:90
verses.text: , Blessed be Thy Birth that has caused stones to cry out!  20.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:91
verses.text: The Star that is written in Scripture, the nations beheld from afar,—that the People might be shamed which is near; O People instructed and puffed up! which by the nations hast been in turn instructed, how and where they saw,—that vision whereof Balaam spake; a stranger he who spread abroad concerning it,—strangers they who saw it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:92
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:93
verses.text: , Blessed is He Who has provoked to jealousy them of His own house!  21.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:94
verses.text: Let my supplication draw nigh to Thy Door, yea my poverty to Thy Treasury!—Give to me my Lord without measure, as God unto man!—And though Thou increase gifts as Son of the Blessed, and though Thou add to them as Son of the King;—though I be thankless as are all creatures of dust, as Adam so is the son of Adam,—and as the Blessed so too is the Son of the Blessed.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:95
verses.text: R.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 17:96
verses.text: , Praise be to Thee Who art like unto Thy Father!.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:1
verses.text: Hymn XVIII.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:2
verses.text: Resp.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:3
verses.text: —Praise be to Him Who sent Him! (bis)  1.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:4
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, for lo! in thee is the sound,—of the great feast the festival of the King!—Sion is deserted, her gates are sore athirst,—and forsaken of festivals.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:5
verses.text: —Blessed thy gates that are open yet not filled,—and thy halls that are enlarged yet suffice not!—In the midst of thee lo! is the sound, of the nations that cry out, and have put to silence the People.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:7
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, that in thy festivals,—the Watchers rejoice amid thy festivity!—for one night the Watchers gave praise,—on the earth which withheld and refused praise.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:8
verses.text: —Blessed thy voices that have been sown and reaped,—and in Heaven stored up in garners!—Thy mouth is a censer, and thy voices as perfumes, breathing vapour in thy festivals.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:10
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, that all oblations,—are brought unto thee in this feast.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:11
verses.text: —The Magi once among traitors, offered them to the Truth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:12
verses.text: —Blessed thy abode that He bowed Himself and dwelt therein, Son of the King Who is worshipped with gifts!—Gold from the West, and spices from the East,—are offered in Thy Festivals.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:14
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, that there is not with thee,—a tyrant King slayer of babes! for he killed in Bethlehem the little ones at random,—that he might put to death the Child that gives life to all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:15
verses.text: —Blessed thy children that are envied and worshipped,—by Kings, for those are promised for Thy worship,—the crowns of the East:—he who trod down thy dear ones, shall be trodden down by thy beloved.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:17
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, for lo! over thee,—Isaiah too exults in his prophecy,—"Lo a Virgin shall conceive and bear,—a Son" Whose name is great mystery!—O interpretation revealed in the Church!—two names that were joined and became one;—"Emmanuel,"—God be with thee ever, Who joined thee with His members!  6.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:18
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, in Micah who cried out,—"A Shepherd shall come forth from Ephrata":—for He came to Bethlehem to take—from thence the rod of Jesse and to rule the nations.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:19
verses.text: —Blessed thy lambs that are sealed with His seal,—and thy sheep that are kept by His sword!—Thou art, O Church,—the abiding Bethlehem,—for in thee is the Bread of Life!  7.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:20
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, for lo! in thee rejoices,—Daniel also the man beloved,—who foretold that the glorious Messiah shall be killed,—and the city of holiness be laid desolate at His killing!—Woe to the People that was rejected and is not converted—Blessed the nations that were called and turned not away!—The bidden guests refused,—and others in their stead enjoyed their banquet.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:22
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, for on thy, lute, lo! King David sings psalms in thee! In the Spirit he sings of Him "Thou art My Son and I—this day have begotten Thee" in the glories of holiness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:23
verses.text: —Blessed thy ears that have been purged to hear!—On His day watch thou as His Body and call on Him;—be taught by Sion,—which saddened His Feast; make Him glad Who has gladdened thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:25
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, that all festivals—have taken flight from Sion and sheltered with thee!—In the midst of thee the wearied Prophets have found rest,—from the labour and the reproachthey bore in Judah.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:26
verses.text: —Blessed the books unrolled in thy temples,—and the festivals celebrated in thy shrines!—Sion is forsaken,—and lo! today the nations shout in thy festivals.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:28
verses.text: Blessed art thou, O Church, in ten blessings,—which our Lord has given as a mystery complete:—for on ten all the numbers hang, therefore art thou perfect by ten blessings.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:29
verses.text: —Blessed thy crowns that are twined—with all blessings mixed in every crown!—O blessed one,—with every blessing crowned, on me too send thy blessing!  11.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:30
verses.text: Blessed art thou, Ephrata, mother of Kings, that from thee sprang the Lord of diadems!—Micah gave thee tidings that He is from everlasting, and the span of His times is not comprehended.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:31
verses.text: —Blessed thine eyes which first of all discerned Him!—thee He deemed worthy to see Him when He appeared,—Chief of benediction,—and Beginning of gladness, thou didst receive first of all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:33
verses.text: Blessed art thou, Bethlehem, that the towns envy thee,—and the fortified cities!—As they envy thee, so the women envy Mary,—and the virgins daughters of princes.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:34
verses.text: —Blessed the maiden in whom He deigned to abide,—and the city wherein He deigned to sojourn;—a poor maiden,—and a small city, He chose Him to humble Himself.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:36
verses.text: Blessed art thou, Bethlehem, that in thee was the beginning,—for Him the Son Who from everlasting is in the Father!—It is hard to comprehend, that before Time He is,—Who in thee made Himself subject to Time.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:37
verses.text: —Blessed thine ears, for in thee first was heard the cry—of the Lamb of God who exulted in thee!—Narrow though thy manger,—He spread Himself on all sides, and was worshipped of every creature.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:39
verses.text: Blessed art thou too, Mary, that thy name—is great and exalted because of thy child!—Thou canst tell then how and how long—and where He dwelt in thee, the great One in small room.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:40
verses.text: —Blessed thy mouth that praised and enquired not,—and thy tongue that glorified and questioned not!—For His Mother was uncertain concerning Him,—even while she carried Him in the womb; who then shall suffice to comprehend Him?  15.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:41
verses.text: O Woman, thou whom no man knew,—how can we behold the Son thou hast borne?—For no eyes suffice to stand—before the transfigurations of the glory, that is on Him.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:42
verses.text: —For tongues of fire abide in Him—Who sent tongues by His Ascension.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:43
verses.text: —Be every tongue warned,—that our questioning is as stubble, and as fire our scrutiny.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:45
verses.text: Blessed is he the priest who in the sanctuary,—offers to the Father the Son of the Father,—the fruit that is plucked from our tree, though it be wholly of the Divine Majesty!—Blessed the hands that are hallowed and offer Him!—and the lips that are spent in kissing Him!—The Spirit in the Temple—longed for His embrace; and at His Crucifixion rent the veil and went forth.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:47
verses.text: The Archangel gave thee greeting,—as the earnest of holiness—Earth became to him new Heavens,—when the Watcher came down and sang glory on it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:48
verses.text: —The sons of the Highest encompassed thy habitation—because of the Son of the King that dwelt in thee.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 18:49
verses.text: —Thy abode below,—to the Heaven above was made like by the host of Watchers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:1
verses.text: Hymn XIX.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:2
verses.text: (Resp.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:3
verses.text: —Blessed be thy Birth that gladdens all creatures!)  1.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:4
verses.text: The first year wherein, our Saviour was born,—is source of blessing, and ground of life;—for by it are borne,—manifold triumphs, the sum of all help:—as the first day of "the beginning,"—the great pillar of all creatures,—bears the building of Creation;—so the year of the Firstborn bears help for man.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:6
verses.text: In the second year, of our Saviour's Birth,—the Magi exult, the Pharisees mourn:—treasures are opened,—kings are hastening, and infants are slain.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:7
verses.text: —For in it are offered in Bethlehem,—oblations precious and terrible;—for while love made offering of gold,—hatred offered infants by the sword.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:9
verses.text: The day of the All-Lightening, exults in His birth;—a pillar of radiance, which drives away, by its beams—the works of darkness.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:10
verses.text: After the type of that day, wherein light was created,—and sundered the darkness that spread—over the fair beauty of Creation;—the radiance of our Saviour's birth—came in to sunder the darkness that was on the heart.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:12
verses.text: The first day the source and the beginning,—orders the roots, to make all things grow.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:13
verses.text: —Our Saviour's day—is praised far above it, a tree planted in the world.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:14
verses.text: —For His Death is as the root in the earth; His Resurrection as the head in heaven; on all sides His words reach as boughs; likewise His Body as fruit for the eaters.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:16
verses.text: Let the second day, sing praise to the Birth—of the second Son, and His voice which first—commanded the firmament and it was made,—divided the waters that were above, and gathered the seas that were under.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:17
verses.text: —He Who divided waters from waters, divided Himself from the Watchers and came down to man.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:18
verses.text: —For the waters which at His command were gathered.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:19
verses.text: —He cleft the fountain of life and gave drink.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:21
verses.text: Let the third day weave with divers hymns—the crown of psalms and with one voice present it—for His Birth who gave growth—of buds and flowers, on the third day.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:22
verses.text: —But now He the All-giver of growth,—has come down and become the All-holy Flower; from the thirsting earth has sprang forth and gone up,—that he may decorate and crown the conquerors.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:24
verses.text: Let the fourth day praise, first among the four,—His Birth Who created as the fourth day—the two lightgivers,—which fools worship, and are sightless and blind.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:25
verses.text: —The Lord of Lightgivers has come down,—and from the womb has shone on us as the Sun.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:26
verses.text: —His splendours have opened the eyes of the blind:—His rays have given light to the wandering.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:28
verses.text: Let the fifth day laud Him Who created—on the fifth day creeping things and Dragons—of whose kind is the serpent.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:29
verses.text: —He deceived with guile our mother, a maid void of counsel.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:30
verses.text: —The deceiver who had mocked the maid,—by the Dove was exposed as false,—which from a virgin bosom sprang, and came forth—the Wise that trod down the crafty.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:32
verses.text: Let the sixth day laud Him who created—on Vesper-day Adam, whom Satan envied; as a feigned friend—cheered him in offering poison in his food.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:33
verses.text: —The medicine of life reached them both,—put on a body and came near to both.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:34
verses.text: —The mortal tasted Him and lived through Him;—the devourer who ate Him was left void.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:36
verses.text: Let the seventh day hallow the Holy One,—Who halloweth the Sabbath, and gave rest to all that live.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:37
verses.text: —The Blessed One Who wearied not—has care for mankind, and has care for the beasts.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:38
verses.text: —When Freedom fell under the yoke,—He came to the Birth and became bond to make it free:—He was smitten on the face by servants in the judgment hall;—He broke the yoke that was on the free, as Lord.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:40
verses.text: Let the eighth day, which circumcised the Hebrews,—praise Him Who commanded his namesake Joshua—to circumcise with a flint—the people circumcised in body, while the heart was profane within.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:41
verses.text: —Lo! as the eighth day, as a Babe,—to circumcision He came Who circumcises all.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:42
verses.text: —Though the sign of Abraham is on His Flesh,—the blind daughter of Sion had defiled it.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:44
verses.text: Let the tenth day sing, praises in its turn.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:45
verses.text: —For God the first letter of Jesus (goodly name!), is ten in numbering.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:46
verses.text: —He Who is as a lamb, turns back the numbers.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:47
verses.text: —For when the number goes up to ten, it is turned back to begin again from one.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:48
verses.text: O great mystery of that which is in Jesus, Whose might turns all creation back again!  13.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:49
verses.text: The All-Purifier Firstborn in the day of His purifying,—purified the purification of the firstborn and was offered in the Temple:—the Lord of offering needed offerings,—to make offering of birds.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:50
verses.text: —In His Birth were fulfilled the types,—in His purification and circumcision the allegories.

verses.name: Hymns of the Nativity 19:51
verses.text: —He came and paid over debts in His coming down;—in His Resurrection He went up and sent down treasures.
